column1: dlga_start:blocked_agent|This person seems busy. Maybe I should move on...{***}
dlga_blocked_agent:close_window|I'm sorry. I didn't mean to disturb you.{***}
dlga_blocked_agent:close_window.1|[Just Leave]{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window|Heel!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window.1|Go, {s1}, go!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window.2|{s1}, stay here!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:wolf_talk_pretrain|Here, I have something for you ...{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window.3|You will be called...{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window.4|Bad wolf! Go away! I don't want you any more!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_2:close_window.5|Drop it!{***}
dlga_start:wolf_talk_recruit|   {***}
dlga_wolf_talk_recruit:wolf_talk_1|Here, have a sausage!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_recruit:close_window|Good wolf!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_recruit:close_window.1|Shoo!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_pretrain:wolf_talk_train|Here, I have something for you ...{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain|You're wounded. Here, have a {s7}!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain.1|You need more strength, this {s7} will make you stronger!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain.2|You need a more powerful bite. This {s7} should help{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain.3|You look malnourished. Here, have some {s7}!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain.4|You could be faster, my friend. Here is some {s7} for you!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_pretrain.5|Here is some {s7} for your teeth!{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_1|I have no more food for you.{***}
dlga_wolf_talk_train:wolf_talk_1.1|That's all for today.{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window|Heel!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window.1|Go, {s1}, go!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window.2|{s1}, stay here!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:dog_talk_pretrain|Here, I have something for you ...{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window.3|You will be called...{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window.4|Bad dog! Go away! I don't want you any more!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_2:close_window.5|Drop it!{***}
dlga_start:dog_talk_recruit|   {***}
dlga_dog_talk_recruit:dog_talk_1|Here, have a sausage!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_recruit:close_window|Good dog!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_recruit:close_window.1|Shoo!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_pretrain:dog_talk_train|Here, I have something for you ...{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain|You're wounded. Here, have a {s7}!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain.1|You need more strength, this {s7} will make you stronger!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain.2|You need a more powerful bite. This {s7} should help{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain.3|You look malnourished. Here, have some {s7}!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain.4|You could be faster, my friend. Here is some {s7} for you!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_pretrain.5|Here is some {s7} for your teeth!{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_1|I have no more food for you.{***}
dlga_dog_talk_train:dog_talk_1.1|That's all for today.{***}
dlga_start:port_chief_travel|Are you looking to travel to another town?{***}
dlga_start:port_chief2|{s1}{***}
dlga_port_chief2:port_chief3|What do you need?{***}
dlga_port_chief3:port_chief_buy_ship|I want to buy a ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief_buy_ship:close_window|Follow me!{***}
dlga_port_chief3:port_chief_info_main|I have some questions about ships and sea travel.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main:port_chief_info_main_1|What do you want to know?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_1:port_chief_info_a_1|Why do people go to sea?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_1:port_chief_info_b_1|How do I find my way at sea?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_1:port_chief_info_c_1|What do I need to know if I want to buy a ship?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_1:port_chief_info_d_1|What makes a ship fast?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_1:port_chief2|That's all I wanted to know. Thanks!{***}

dlga_port_chief_info_a_1:port_chief_info_main|You can earn a lot of money if you trade goods or slaves across the sea. Others use it for raiding settlements. Finally, no Ironborn will respect you as a leader if you don't have a good ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_a_1:port_chief_info_main.1|You can earn a lot of money if you trade goods or slaves across the sea. Others use it for raiding settlements.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_b_1:port_chief_info_main|Look at the sun at day. Rest at night. The better you are at finding your way, the faster you travel.{***}

dlga_port_chief_info_c_1:port_chief_info_c_2|First, you need to know what type of ship you want. If you want to trade, then a Merchant ship may be a good choice. They have much room for cargo, but they are not very fast. The Warship, the Galley and the Cog are fast warships and are able to carry many troops. The longship is something in-between. If you only have a few men and little coin, then just a small row boat would perhaps suit you better.{***}

dlga_port_chief_info_c_2:port_chief_info_main|The second important factor is the type of wood the ship is made from. Ships made out of oak wood are the best ships, but are also expensive. Beech is cheaper, but it rots faster.{***}

dlga_port_chief_info_d_1:port_chief_info_main|The wind -- if you place your sails in a position to catch it best. If there is no wind at all, then your crew has to row. More rowers will make the ship faster. If you have more than one ship in your fleet, then your fleet will only be as fast as your slowest ship. A skilled Navigator can also make your fleet faster.{***}
dlga_port_chief3:port_chief_travel|I want to travel to another port.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel:close_window|I'm sorry. There are currently no passenger ships in this port that can transport a marshal and his whole army.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel:close_window.1|I'm sorry. There are currently no passenger ships in this port that can transport your party and the trader with his whole cargo.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel:port_chief_travel_2|Where do you want to go?{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel:close_window.2|I am sorry. There are currently no passenger ships in this port.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_2:port_chief_travel_3|{s1}{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_2:close_window|I changed my mind.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_3:port_chief_travel_4|You want to travel to {s1}? {s2}{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_4:port_chief_travel_5|Sure, lets go.{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_4:port_chief2|{s1}{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_4:close_window|{s1}{***}
dlga_port_chief_travel_5:close_window|Then come aboard and we shall leave right away.{***}
dlga_port_chief3:port_chief_pick_up_ship1|Is my ship ready yet?{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship1:port_chief2|My men and I are still working on it. Come back in {reg1} days.{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship1:port_chief_pick_up_ship2|The ship is ready! Do you want us to launch it?{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship2:port_chief_pick_up_ship3|Yes!{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship2:port_chief2|No, not yet.{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship3:port_chief2|Sorry, your sailing master skill isn't high enough to add an additional ship to your current fleet in this port.{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship3:close_window|Well, take a look at it and give it a name.{***}
dlga_port_chief_pick_up_ship3:port_chief2.1|There is not enough room left in the port for another ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief3:port_chief_build_ship_main|I want you to build me a ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main:port_chief2|A ship? We are Dothraki, we do not build ships!{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main:port_chief_build_ship_main_1|What kind of ship do you want to have?{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2|I just need a little row boat.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.1|I want a Merchant Ship for trading.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.2|I want a large attack ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.3|A good attack Galley!{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.4|I'm interested in a warship. A Large Galley, please.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.5|I have many warriors. Can you build a Cog for me?{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief_build_ship_main_2.6|I need a good, all-round ship. A Longship should do.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_1:port_chief2|I changed my mind.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_2:port_chief_build_ship_main|Sorry, we only have the skills and resources required to build small boats.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_2:port_chief_info_main_3|What kind of wood would you like to use?{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_3:port_chief_build_ship_main_4|Oak wood. I want quality.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_3:port_chief_build_ship_main_4.1|Pine would be fine.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_3:port_chief_build_ship_main_4.2|I don't want to spend too much. Ash wood will do.{***}
dlga_port_chief_info_main_3:port_chief2|I changed my mind.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_4:port_chief_build_ship_main_5|To build your {s11} out of {s12} wood I ask {reg11} stags for my work. {s2}It will take {reg12} days to build this ship.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_5:port_chief_build_ship_main_6|Build this ship for me!{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_5:port_chief_build_ship_missing_1|Err, does it look like I am a merchant? I don't have these things with me.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_missing_1:port_chief2|Sorry, but I can't finish your ship without these materials. Buy them and come back once you have everything ready.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_5:port_chief_build_ship_missing_2|I don't have enough stags right now.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_missing_2:port_chief2|Sorry, but I need to feed my family and pay the workers. When you have the coin, come back and see me.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_5:port_chief_build_ship_missing_3|I will consider this and may come back later.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_missing_3:port_chief2|Take your time, but trust me. My ships are worth every stag.{***}
dlga_port_chief_build_ship_main_6:port_chief2|Very well! Come back in {reg12} days.{***}
dlga_port_chief3:close_window|Nothing, for now. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:port_prisoners|Who are you?{***}
dlga_port_prisoners:port_prisoners_2|Are you looking for a slave trader? {s9} wouldn't prosper without my slaves, so if you have any prisoners of war, I'd be willing to buy them.{***}
dlga_port_prisoners_2:port_prisoners_3|I've brought some prisoners.{***}
dlga_port_prisoners_2:close_window|Farewell.{***}
dlga_port_prisoners_3:port_prisoners_4|Nice to hear. Let's go.{***}
dlga_port_prisoners_4:close_window|A pleasure doing business with you.{***}
dlga_start:port_r_2|Greetings. I'm a veteran captain who monitors activity at the port of {s9}. If you are interested in hiring unemployed sailors, let me know.{***}
dlga_port_crew_talk:port_r_2|Is there anything else I can do for you?{***}
dlga_port_r_2:port_recruitsl|I want to recruit sailors.{***}
dlga_port_recruitsl:port_crew_talk|There are no available sailors in the port at this time. Come back later, {reg59?madam:ser}.{***}
dlga_port_recruitsl:port_crew_talk.1|I don't think anyone would be interested, {reg59?madam:ser}. You need to have more room in your party.{***}
dlga_port_recruitsl:port_recruits2|I can think of {reg5} who I suspect would jump at the chance if you could pay 40 stags {reg7?each for their equipment:for his equipment}. Does that suit you?{***}
dlga_port_recruits2:port_crew_talk|Tell {reg7?them:him} to get ready.{***}
dlga_port_recruits2:port_crew_talk.1|No, not now.{***}
dlga_port_r_2:close_window|I want to go. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.1|This person looks quite busy. I think I shouldn't interrupt.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal:award_fief_to_vassal_defer|I wish to defer the appointment of a lord until I take the counsel of my subjects there.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal:award_fief_to_vassal_defer.1|I wish to defer the appointment of a lord until I have finished... determining its value.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal_defer:close_window|As you wish, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. You may decide this matter at a later date.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal:award_fief_to_vassal_2|Let's sack the place and leave.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal:award_fief_to_vassal_2.1|I want this place destroyed! We have no need of it.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal_2:close_window|As you wish, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal_2:close_window.1|As you wish, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.{***}
dlga_award_fief_to_vassal_2:close_window.2|We have no possibility of doing this. The men insist that we devastate this site and leave, {reg59?my lady:my lord}.{***}
dlga_event_triggered:center_captured_rebellion|{s1} isn't being managed by anyone. Whom shall I put in charge?{***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion:center_captured_rebellion_2|{s11}. {s1}{***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion:center_captured_rebellion_2.1|Please, {s65}, I want to have {s1} for myself. (fiefs: {s0}){***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion:center_captured_rebellion_2.2|{s66}, you should have {s1} for yourself. (fiefs: {s0}){***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion:center_captured_rebellion_2_defer|You should appoint no one yet and decide later.{***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion_2_defer:close_window|Hmmm. All right, {playername}. I value your counsel highly.  I shall defer appointment of a lord for {s1} until later.{***}
dlga_center_captured_rebellion_2:close_window|Hmmm. All right, {playername}. I value your counsel highly. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.{***}

dlga_start:fighter_talk|Hello there. We're polishing off our combat skills here with a bit of sparring practice. You look like you could use a bit of training. Why don't you join us? We could show you a few tricks. And if you need explanation of any combat concepts, just ask, and I'll do my best to fill you in.{***}
dlga_start:fighter_talk.1|What do you want to practice?{***}
dlga_fighter_pretalk:fighter_talk|Tell me what kind of practice you want.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk:fighter_talk_train_attack|I want to practice attacking.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk:fighter_talk_train_parry|I want to practice blocking with my weapon.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk:fighter_talk_train_combat|Let's do some sparring practice.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk:close_window|[Leave]{***}

dlga_fighter_talk_train_attack:fighter_talk_train_attack_2|All right. There are four principle directions for attacking. These are overhead swing, right swing, left swing and thrust. Now, I will tell you which direction to attack from, and you must try to do the correct attack. ^^(Move your mouse while you press the left mouse button to specify attack direction. For example, to execute an overhead attack, move the mouse up at the instant you press the left mouse button. The icons on your screen will help you do the correct action.){***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_attack_2:close_window|Let's begin then. I'm ready.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_attack_2:fighter_pretalk|Actually I want to do something else.{***}

dlga_fighter_talk_train_parry:fighter_talk_train_parry_2|Unlike a shield, blocking with a weapon can only stop attacks coming from one direction. For example, if you block up, you'll deflect overhead attacks, but you can still be hit by side swings or thrust attacks. ^^(You must press and hold down the right mouse button to block.){***}

dlga_fighter_talk_train_parry_2:fighter_talk_train_parry_3|I'll now attack you with different types of strokes, and I'll wait until you do the correct block before attacking. Try to do the correct block as soon as you can. ^^(This practice is easy to do with the 'automatic block direction' setting which is the default. If you go to the options menu and change defend direction control to 'mouse movement' or 'keyboard', you'll need to manually choose block direction. This is much more challenging but also makes the game more interesting. This practice can be very useful if you use manual blocking.){***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_parry_3:close_window|Let's begin then. I'm ready.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_parry_3:fighter_pretalk|Actually I want to do something else.{***}

dlga_fighter_talk_train_combat:fighter_talk_train_combat_2|Sparring is an excellent way to prepare for actual combat. We'll fight each other with non-lethal weapons now, until one of us falls to the ground. You can get some bruises of course, but better that than being cut down in the real thing.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_combat_2:close_window|Let's begin then. I'm ready.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_train_combat_2:fighter_pretalk|Actually I want to do something else.{***}

dlga_start:fighter_parry_try_again|Good. You were able to block my attacks successfully. You may repeat this practice and try to get faster each time, until you are confident of your defence skills. Do you want to have another go?{***}

dlga_start:fighter_parry_try_again.1|Well, that didn't go too well, did it? (Remember, you must press and hold down the right mouse button to keep your block effective.) Do you want to try again?{***}
dlga_fighter_parry_try_again:fighter_talk_train_parry|Yes. Let's try again.{***}
dlga_fighter_parry_try_again:fighter_talk_leave_parry|No, I think I'm done for now.{***}
dlga_start:fighter_parry_warn|Hey! We're doing a blocking practice, mate! You're supposed to block my attacks, not attack me back.{***}
dlga_fighter_parry_warn:fighter_talk_train_parry|I'm sorry. Let's try once again.{***}
dlga_fighter_parry_warn:fighter_talk_leave_parry|Sorry. I must leave this practice now.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_leave_parry:close_window|All right. As you wish.{***}
dlga_start:fighter_combat_try_again|Well, that didn't go too well, did it?  Don't feel bad, and try not to do same mistakes next time. Do you want to have a go again?{***}
dlga_fighter_combat_try_again:fighter_talk_train_combat|Yes. Let's do another round.{***}
dlga_fighter_combat_try_again:fighter_talk_leave_combat|No. That was enough for me.{***}
dlga_fighter_talk_leave_combat:close_window|Well, all right. Talk to me again if you change your mind.{***}
dlga_start:fighter_combat_try_again.1|Hey, that was good sparring. You've defeated me, but next time I'll be more careful. Do you want to have a go again?{***}
dlga_start:fighter_talk.2|Very good. You've learned how to attack from any direction you want. If you like, we can try this again or move to a different exercise.{***}

dlga_start:archer_challenge_2|Not bad. Not bad at all! You seem to have grasped the basics of archery. Now, try to do the same thing with a crossbow. Take the crossbow and the bolts over there and shoot those three targets. The crossbow is much easier to shoot with compared with the bow, but you need to reload it after each shot.{***}

dlga_start:archer_challenge_2.1|Good. You didn't have too much difficulty using the crossbow either. Next you will learn to use throwing weapons. Pick up the javelins you see over there and try to hit those three targets. {***}

dlga_start:ranged_end|Well, with that you have received the basic skills to use all three types of ranged weapons. The rest will come with practice. Train each and every day, and in time you'll be as good as the best marksmen in Westeros and Essos.{***}
dlga_ranged_end:close_window|Now you can go talk with the melee fighters or the horsemanship trainer if you haven't already done so. They can teach you important skills too.{***}

dlga_start:archer_talk|Good day to you, young fellow. I spend my days teaching about ranged weapons to anyone that is willing to learn. If you need a tutor, let me know and I'll teach you how to use the bow, the crossbow or the javelin.{***}
dlga_archer_talk:archer_challenge|Yes, show me how to use ranged weapons.{***}
dlga_archer_talk:close_window|No, not now.{***}

dlga_archer_challenge:archer_challenge_2|All right. Your first training will be in archery. The bow is a difficult weapon to master. But once you are sufficiently good at it, you can shoot quickly and with great power. Go pick up the bow and arrows you see over there now and shoot those targets.{***}
dlga_archer_challenge_2:close_window|All right. I'm ready.{***}
dlga_archer_challenge_2:close_window.1|Just a minute. I want to do something else first.{***}

dlga_start:horseman_melee_challenge_2|I hope you've enjoyed the ride. Now we move on to something a bit more difficult. Grab the lance you see over there and ride around the course hitting each target at least once.{***}

dlga_start:horseman_melee_challenge_2.1|Good! You have been able to hit all targets on horseback. That's no easy feat for a starter. Your next challenge will be using a bow and arrows to shoot at the archery targets by the road. You need to put an arrow to each target to consider yourself successful.{***}
dlga_start:horsemanship_end|Very good. You were able to shoot all targets from horseback. Keep riding and practising each day and in time you will be an expert horseman.{***}

dlga_horsemanship_end:close_window|Now you can go talk with the melee fighters or the archery trainer if you haven't already done so. You need to learn everything you can to be prepared when you have to defend yourself.{***}

dlga_start:horseman_talk|Good day! I have come here for some riding practice, but my old bones are aching badly so I've decided to give myself a rest today. If you would like to practice your horsemanship, you can take my horse here. The exercise would be good for her.{***}
dlga_horseman_talk:horseman_challenge|Yes, I would like to practice riding.{***}
dlga_horseman_talk:close_window|Uhm. Maybe later.{***}

dlga_horseman_challenge:horseman_melee_challenge_2|Good. Now I'll give you a few exercises that'll teach you riding and horseback weapon use. Your first assignment is simple. Just take your horse for a ride around the course. Go as slow or as fast as you like. Come back when you feel confident as a rider and I'll give you some tougher exercises.{***}
dlga_horseman_melee_challenge_2:close_window|All right. I'm ready.{***}
dlga_horseman_melee_challenge_2:close_window.1|Just a minute. I need to do something else first.{***}
dlga_tutorial_troop_default:close_window|Hey, I'm trying to practice here. Go, talk with the archery trainer if you need guidance about ranged weapons.{***}
dlga_start:lord_prison_break_confirm_3|Is there a change of plans?{***}
dlga_start:lord_prison_break|What's going on?{***}
dlga_start:drunk_response|What are you looking at?{***}
dlga_start:drunk_response.1|Are you looking at me?{***}
dlga_player_duel_response:close_window|Such a waste.{***}
dlga_player_duel_response:close_window.1|Better him than me.{***}
dlga_drunk_response:drunk_fight_start|I'm not sure. Some sort of animal, clearly.{***}
dlga_drunk_response:drunk_fight_start.1|Sorry - please accept my apologies.{***}
dlga_drunk_fight_start:close_window|I'll wipe that smirk right off your face!{***}
dlga_drunk_response:drunk_player_high_renown|Do you have any idea who I am?{***}
dlga_drunk_player_high_renown:drunk_fight_start|Do I care?{***}

dlga_drunk_player_high_renown:drunk_player_high_renown|Ermmm... actually... yes, yes, I do know who you are, {ser/madame}. Please forgive me, your grace, it must be the drink. I'll be leaving, now...{***}
dlga_drunk_player_high_renown:drunk_fight_start.1|Why, if you want a fight, you shall have one!{***}
dlga_drunk_player_high_renown:close_window|I thought as much. Now remove yourself from here!{***}
dlga_start:fistfight_response|You look like a {fellow/lady} who can take a few hard knocks - and deal them out as well. I've a business proposition for you.{***}
dlga_fistfight_response:fistfight_response_2|How's that?{***}
dlga_fistfight_response_2:fistfight_response_2a|Good - I'm glad you're interested, {lad/lassie}. Here's the plan: it's a little complicated, so listen well. {***}

dlga_fistfight_response_2a:fistfight_response_3|You and this other fellow will start up a fight here. No weapons, no armour. I'll sit back, take bets, and split the profits with the winner. If we make a loss, then I'll cover it. You've got nothing to lose, except a bit of blood, of course.{***}

dlga_fistfight_response_3:fistfight_response_4|However, we can't organize this like one of those nice arena bouts where everyone places their bets beforehand. People will walk in, drawn by the noise, and put a silver stag or two on whichever one of you two they think is winning. I'll give 'em even odds. Anything else is going to be too tricky for someone who's already on his third flagon of ale.{***}

dlga_fistfight_response_4:fistfight_response_4a|As you can see, the trick is to stretch things out for as long as possible where it looks like you're losing, so people bet against you. Then you come back fast and win before the betting can turn. The best way to make money is for you to be battered almost to the floor and then jump back off your feet and take the other guy down. But don't forget it, {lad/lassie}, you have to win in the end in order for me, and you, to make money.{***}

dlga_fistfight_response_4a:fistfight_response_5|Nonetheless, you can't stretch the fight out too long, or people will suspect a fix: one of you has to take a punch every so often. I don't care whose blood is spilled, but there has to be some blood.{***}

dlga_fistfight_response_5:fistfight_response_5a|And one other thing, {boy/girl}, your opponent doesn't take too well to complexity: he's just going to come straight at you. It's up to you to supply the artistry.{***}
dlga_fistfight_response_5a:fistfight_response_confirm|So, what do you think?{***}
dlga_fistfight_response_confirm:close_window.1|I've better things to do.{***}
dlga_start:nw_rangers_aggro_1|Hold it!{***}
dlga_start:nw_rangers_1|Greetings, brother. How goes the watch?{***}
dlga_start:nw_rangers_2|Greetings, traveller. What brings you to these parts?{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_2:nw_rangers_3|I wish to join the Night's Watch.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_2:nw_rangers_6|I am just exploring the North.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_2:nw_rangers_7|Your watch has come to an end. Let the Thenns be feasting on your flesh tonight!{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_3:nw_rangers_4|I'm sorry, ma'am, but the Watch accepts only men.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_3:nw_rangers_4.1|If you wish to join us, go to Castle Black and do so. We need every man we can muster.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_4:nw_rangers_5|Now if you would excuse us, we are on duty. Farewell.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_5:close_window|Farewell.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_6:close_window|Exploring is a risky endeavour around here, traveller. Keep an eye out for trouble.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_7:close_window|So be it, scum! Now you must die!  BROTHERS! TO ARMS!{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_1:nw_rangers_8|I've been trailing some Wildling raiders.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_1:nw_rangers_9|Nothing much of interest, ser.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_8:close_window|Find and destroy them, brother, and may the Seven guide you.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_9:close_window|Then enjoy the day, brother.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_aggro_1:close_window|Come then, crows!{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_aggro_1:nw_rangers_aggro_2|Gentlemen, let's keep this civil, eh.{***}
dlga_nw_rangers_aggro_2:close_window|The only civility you'll be getting is my blade.{***}
dlga_start:ff_r_01|Well, what do you know, boys! A crow about to die!{***}
dlga_start:ff_r_01.1|Well well, what do we have here?{***}
dlga_start:ff_r_02|Hello there, {brother/sister}! How's the huntin' going?{***}
dlga_start:ff_r_03|Ya? What do you want?{***}
dlga_ff_r_03:ff_r_04|I want to join your clan.{***}
dlga_ff_r_03:close_window|Only to see your corpse before me.{***}
dlga_ff_r_03:close_window.1|Nothing, sorry to bother you.{***}
dlga_ff_r_04:close_window|You? To join us? Hmph.^Go find {s1}. He'll decide if you're fit or not.{***}
dlga_ff_r_02:close_window|We shan't be going hungry tonight, if you catch my drift, heheh.{***}
dlga_ff_r_02:ff_r_03|Agh, no such luck yet.{***}
dlga_ff_r_03:close_window.2|Haha, good luck to you then.{***}
dlga_ff_r_01:close_window|Show me your steel, scum!{***}
dlga_start:close_window.4|Your life ends here, Wildling!{***}
dlga_start:nw_r_01|Ah, good to see you, brother.{***}
dlga_start:nw_r_04|Greetings, traveller. What can I do for you?{***}
dlga_nw_r_01:nw_r_02|How goes the recruiting?{***}
dlga_nw_r_01:nw_r_03|You need any help?{***}
dlga_nw_r_02:close_window|Bah! Only scoundrels and scum bags, like usual. These are dark times for the Watch, brother.{***}
dlga_nw_r_03:close_window|Nah, I can handle it. You should be attending to your own duties though, shouldn't you?{***}
dlga_nw_r_04:nw_r_05|I wish to join the Night's Watch.{***}
dlga_nw_r_04:nw_r_06|You can give up your steel or die a slow death!{***}
dlga_nw_r_04:close_window|Nothing, sorry.{***}
dlga_nw_r_05:nw_r_07|You seem like an able man, and the Seven know we need all the help we can get.^You should go to Castle Black and speak with {s1}.{***}
dlga_nw_r_05:close_window|Sorry to say, but the Watch accepts only men, so you can't join us. Nothing
column2: maybe there's a better occupation for you somewhere else.{***}

column1: dlga_nw_r_06:close_window|So be it, though such aggression is irrational. Grab your blade and pray the Seven have mercy.{***}
dlga_nw_r_07:close_window|Thank you. I will.{***}
dlga_start:varys_intro_1|Well met, weary traveller, I'm Lord Varys and I serve here in King's Landing.{***}
dlga_varys_intro_1:varys_intro_2|The Master of Whispers on the King’s Small Council?{***}
dlga_varys_intro_1:close_window|I should be leaving.{***}

dlga_varys_intro_2:varys_intro_3|Very perceptive of you, {ser/madam}. Yes, I'm the Master of Whispers and an advisor to the King. I serve whomever sits the Iron Throne, who at this moment in time happens to be {s1}. Now, what business do have here in King's Landing?{***}
dlga_varys_intro_3:varys_intro_4|Sorry, I'm not one to disclose my secrets to just anyone.{***}
dlga_varys_intro_4:varys_generic|No need, {playername}, Westeros is full of little birds that whisper me secrets, my friend. Something you should do wise to remember.{***}
dlga_varys_generic:varys_quest_1|Is there anything I can do for you, Lord Varys?{***}
dlga_varys_generic:close_window|Apologies, I must take my leave.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.5|Hello again, {playername}. It's good to see you
column2: however, I'm rather busy at the moment. Maybe we can talk some other time.{***}

column1: dlga_start:close_window.6|Hello again, {playername}. I'm happy to see you again. Unfortunately, I've got no need of you right now. Maybe some other time.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_1:varys_quest_2|Well, it’s not every day I find a {man/woman} seeking to earn my favour - very few would be of a mind. The King would offer lands and titles for the heads of his enemies. Lord Baelish would proffer coin for those who work on his behalf. Many a lord and indeed many a king would offer much the same, but me? Why, I've only the reward of my friendship. If that is no use to you, then I bid you good day.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2:varys_quest_3|Friendship to the greatest spymaster in all the lands is nothing to squander if you offer it, Lord Varys.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2:close_window|Well then, I suppose I'd best be on my way.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_3:varys_quest_4|Hmm, yes - we'll see. Well, if you're so eager to please me, I do happen to have a small errand to run. An agent of mine in Dorne is due to deliver to me a report on certain goings-on. Normally I would send one of my usual little helpers, but you seem ready for the journey right now. Make your way to Sunspear and introduce yourself to everyone you meet as a merchant selling happy dreams. My agent will greet you with a request for sad memories.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_4:varys_quest_5|You'll be given a roll of paper with a coded message, which you're to deliver to me in haste. I trust you're up to this task?{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5:close_window|It shall be done, Lord Varys.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5:varys_quest_6|I'm afraid I cannot complete the task at this time.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_6:close_window|Such a pity. Well, you're unfortunately of no use to me then. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:varys_quest_report|Hello again, {playername}. I trust things are well?{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_1_done|I've got your message with me.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_2_report|About catching that spy...{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_3_done|I've eliminated the knights.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_4_done|I bring you the dozen Skilled Bravos.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_5_done|I've delivered the message, and I agreed.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_report:varys_quest_not_yet_done|I'm still working on the task you gave me.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_not_yet_done:close_window|Good, good. Just don't take too long.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_1_done:close_window|Ah, my message. The seal is unbroken and my cipher is undisturbed, well done. I may have misled you earlier, for I'm no Master of Coin, but I've my ways of acquiring needed funds. Here you go, and do remember to come back later in case I might have further use for you.{***}
dlga_start:varys_quest_2_1|Ah, {playername}! It is fortunate that you've arrived
column2: I've got a job for someone of your calibre. In this city, at this very moment, is a spy, and not one in my service, I might add. I know who he is and what his business here is, and though it would be simplicity itself to have him seized, I fear that this act might alert his cohorts within the walls. He intends to leave tonight and head south by the Kingsroad
column3: my sources report him earlier asking travellers about that way. Like as not, the man intends to meet someone far from prying eyes, and I want you to follow him. Capturing the spy is paramount, but his contact would be an excellent prize as well. They may have escorts: deal with them as you see fit.{***}

column1: dlga_varys_quest_2_1:varys_quest_2_2|Are you prepared for this assignment?{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_2:close_window|It shall be done, my lord.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_2:varys_quest_2_3|I'm afraid I cannot complete the task at this time.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_3:close_window|This is rather unfortunate then. In this case, I won't be needing your services any more.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_2_report:varys_quest_2_succeeded|Ah, you've arrived - and with our late visitor to this fine city in tow. And it appears his friend is also in your custody. Well, I must say you've certainly earned your reward for a job well done. Worry not, I shall not harm either of them. They'll be detained for as long as it takes to resolve certain matters, which may be greatly sped up by their cooperation, of course. You know, I'm starting to see the allure of retaining the services of such warriors as yourself. I deal with kings and noble lords on a regular basis, but even the guards of this city will only heed my requests for fear of angering those whom I serve. Thank you once more for your services, and here is your payment. Take this as well. I've just finished reading it myself. “A History of the Great Sieges of Westeros”, by Archmaester Ch’Vyalthan
column2: the man was not the best writer, but he had some good advice on how best to assail a fortified position. Hardly a use to me, but you may find it insightful.{***}

column1: dlga_varys_quest_2_report:varys_quest_2_half_done|Ah, you've arrived - and with our late visitor to this fine city in tow I see. And what of his contact? I understand... well, unfortunate but no great loss. Worry not, I shall not harm the man. He'll be detained for as long as it takes to resolve certain matters, which may be greatly sped up by his cooperation, of course. You know, I'm starting to see the allure of retaining the services of such warriors as yourself. I deal with kings and noble lords on a regular basis, but even the guards of this city will only heed my requests for fear of angering those whom I serve. Thank you once more for your services, and here is your payment.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_2_report:varys_quest_2_half_done.1|Ah, you've arrived. Though it would seem that you've lost the target. Oh, you've got his contact in your custody? Very good, he should prove most useful. Worry not, I shall not harm the man. He'll be detained for as long as it takes to resolve certain matters, which may be greatly sped up by his cooperation, of course. You know, I'm starting to see the allure of retaining the services of such warriors as yourself. I deal with kings and noble lords on a regular basis, but even the guards of this city will only heed my requests for fear of angering those whom I serve. Thank you once more for your services, and here is your payment.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_2_report:varys_quest_2_failed|Ah, you've arrived... too bad that you've managed to lose both of the targets. This means that everything was in vain and that I shan't be able to extract any information from them. But worry not, I'll do you no harm, but I'm unable to reward you, given that you've not completed your job. I also think that I'll no longer have use of your services. Farewell.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_succeeded:close_window|Thank you, my lord.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_half_done:close_window|I did my best, my lord.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_2_failed:close_window|Hmph. As you like, my lord.{***}

dlga_start:varys_quest_3_1|Hello again, my friend, it is good to see you once more. An urgent matter has arisen - one I think you are best suited to resolve. I'll be brief: a rather large group of hedge knights has set up camp on the road leading to Duskendale. They claim to be about the King’s business, which is, strictly speaking, untrue. I need you to assemble your own force and march out to meet them. Kill or capture every last one of them
column2: they must ultimately be dispersed. I know I'm asking a great deal of you, but I assure you that this is for the good of the realm. I trust in your discretion and efficiency as before. Well, are you up to the task?{***}

column1: dlga_varys_quest_3_1:close_window|I'll do it, Lord Varys.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_3_1:varys_quest_2_3|I'm afraid I cannot complete the task at this time.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_3_done:varys_quest_3_2|It does me no end of good to see you safe and sound. My little birds report a disturbance on the road to Duskendale. A nasty business, but you're to be commended for your performance on the field. I suppose there's little point in hiding the truth of the matter from you now that the deed is done.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_3_2:varys_quest_3_3|Those hedge knights you encountered, and so roundly defeated, were pawns in the employ of the Master of Coins, our own Lord Baelish. They, of course, would not have known that: he used channels available only to a member of the Small Council to encourage the notion that they were on some grand venture on behalf of the King. Without any doubt he'll have little trouble replacing them
column2: the lands are rife with such desperate men. But your actions have stymied his plans and set his schemes back for the moment.{***}

column1: dlga_varys_quest_3_3:varys_quest_3_4|Do not act so surprised, the Master of Coins he may be, but Petyr Baelish is no man to underestimate. His ambitions are a threat to the stability of the realm, and I strongly suspect he had a hand in bringing about the chaos that has engulfed Westeros. However, this is no concern to leave on your head. You've done your part, my {friend/lady}. Here's your payment, as expected, and a special gift. The one gathering dust in the royal armoury is merely a cheap replica, but only its original owner would ever be able to tell the difference. Fortunately, that's no concern that need ever cross your mind.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_3_4:close_window|Thank you, my lord.{***}

dlga_start:varys_quest_4_1|Well, my {friend/lady}, it seems that in spite of myself I've grown to rely upon you. It's so hard to find good help these days, and in time it will grow harder still. I've another task for you, one thankfully less exciting than the one I handed you earlier. Are you familiar with Skilled Bravos? Expert swordsmen, unequalled in the use of light blades and revered for their martial prowess among the Free Cities. Their talents are mostly disregarded in Westeros, where the value of a warrior is his ability to slaughter his opponents rather than eloquently dispatch them.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_4_1:varys_quest_4_2|Still, for certain reasons I'm in need of a dozen or so Skilled Bravos – and I need you to acquire them. Train them or hire them, but I need them assembled and brought to me to direct as I see fit. As much as it pains me to do so, I cannot reveal to you what I intend to do with them. For now know that you'll be very well rewarded for your trials and shall have my personal confidence upon completion of this venture.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_4_2:close_window|That will take time, Lord Varys, but I'll see to it.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_4_2:varys_quest_2_3|I fear this task is beyond me for the moment.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_4_done:close_window|Marvellous, these men are just as I've requested. An old friend of mine in the Free Cities is in need of their services, a very wealthy man with great influence in Essos. You see, swordsmen of such extraordinary skills as those of your new compatriots are a valued commodity among certain circles in the Free Cities - more so if their talents are proven on the field of battle. Your comrades will want for nothing in their new life working for my old friend, and in turn he shall accrue great prestige from having them in his retinue. I'll say no more, other than that you've proven a most valuable agent to me. Your reward, my {friend/lady}, as promised. Use it in good health.{***}

dlga_start:varys_quest_5_1|Ah, it's you. I trust you've been well since our last meeting? These are dangerous times, and I like to make sure that my friends are in good health. Today at least has been a good one, the wind has sent away the foul odours that normally arise from the city's lower quarters, and the sun was kind enough to hide behind the odd cloud. It feels perfect for a stroll – why don’t you meet me behind the Sept of Baelor and we can discuss some items of note?{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5_1:close_window|An odd request, but certainly.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5_1:varys_quest_2_3|I don’t have time to wander about the city, Varys.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.7|Meet me behind the Great Sept of Baelor, {playername}. Then, we shall speak.{***}

dlga_start:varys_quest_5_2|Ah, the Sept of Baelor - beautiful, isn’t it? Fully recovered from the sack of King's Landing during King Robert’s rebellion. It was the only building project Lord Tywin deigned to contribute to free of charge after his army returned home with their plunder.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_5_2:varys_quest_5_3|We're standing not far from where Lord Eddard Stark, former Hand of the King, lost his head. He was a good man and didn't deserve this fate or the misery that befell his family. But in my experience people rarely get what they deserve: often those are punished who should be praised, and those who are praised should instead be punished. After the Sack of King's Landing, Eddard Stark was the only lord to demand any justice for the murders of Elia of Dorne and her children. He nearly lost his head then too. What do you think? Would you've agreed with Eddard Stark - did the Targaryen children and their mother not deserve justice?{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5_3:varys_quest_5_5|No one deserved that, least of all a mother and her children.{***}
dlga_varys_quest_5_3:varys_quest_5_4|Her children were incest born dragon spawns. It needed to be done.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_5_4:close_window|I see. A common view held by those who would align themselves with the high courts of this land. What use to fight for the dead, after all? Here, the remainder of your payment. You’ve done nothing wrong, but I cannot retain the services of more public agents for long lest they be targeted by my adversaries. Seek out others in the Court who could use your skill, or take to the field and claim your own glory. May it as it be, but our work together is at an end. Now, I believe there is a new shipment of saffron just in from across the Narrow Sea. Always a delight to meet new people, wouldn’t you agree? I bid you a good day.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_5_5:close_window|A most rare insight. Very few would utter such words for fear of angering those who have risen on the downfall of the Targaryen family. Your compassion does you credit, as does your dedication to the realm. You've proven yourself a valuable ally to me, which is why I've one more task for you. I need you to return to Dorne once more, this time with a message in hand. Seek an audience with Ellaria Sand, and all will be explained. I've got much to prepare for, and I hope you make the right decision. Fare you well.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_5_done:close_window|You're truly a noble {man/woman}, {playername}. I'm delighted that you've made the right decision. You'll always be a friend to me, and I thank you for your services to the realm.{***}

dlga_varys_quest_5_5:close_window.1|A most rare insight. Very few would utter such words for fear of angering those who have risen on the downfall of the Targaryen family. Your compassion does you credit, as does your dedication to the realm. You've proven yourself a valuable ally to me, which is why I've one more task for you. I need you to return to Dorne once more, this time with a message in hand. Seek an audience with Prince Doran Martell, Oberyn’s brother, and all will be explained. I've got much to prepare for, and I hope you make the right decision. Fare you well.{***}
dlga_start:varys_generic|Hello again, my {good Ser/sweet Lady}. What brings you to me?{***}

dlga_start:doran_1|So, you're Varys agent? I'd never expected him to contract someone openly, especially a warrior such as yourself. He's many who serve him, but few walk openly in the light as you do. I'm Prince Doran Martell, ruler of Dorne. Prince Oberyn Martell leads our armies and acts in my capacity due to my... ailments. The message you've brought me is brief but speaks of your reliability. I hope that's the case.{***}
dlga_doran_1:doran_2|Why do you serve the Spider? For baubles perhaps, or does his talk of serving the realm appeal to your sense of duty?{***}
dlga_doran_2:doran_3|He speaks of serving the realm, not just whomever sits the throne or himself.{***}
dlga_doran_2:doran_3.1|He's been a good patron to me so far.{***}

dlga_doran_3:doran_4|Westeros is torn by war, those who should protect it instead destroy it. I fear dark days are ahead for Dorne if the land should trade wardens for warlords intent on their own enrichment. The North and the Riverlands both strive for their independence, the Lannisters seek to regain control no matter the cost, Stannis fights for dominance whilst the Reach blunders under the direction of Mace Tyrell, and the Vale and the Iron Islands do as they please. These conflicts are a festering wound that needs be cauterized by fire. Only one House has ever managed to unite these desperate lands, and they did so 300 years ago.{***}
dlga_doran_4:doran_5|The Targaryens - but they're all dead, aren't they?{***}

dlga_doran_5:doran_6|Not all, no. Two remain in the world to my knowledge. Alas, the third one fell victim to a crown of molten gold. Only one is within reach of contact, and only through a source you and I both know.{***}
dlga_doran_6:doran_7|Varys? What does he have to do with all this?{***}

dlga_doran_7:doran_8|Everything. When King’s Landing fell, so Varys tells me, he secured the safety of my sister's youngest child at the terrible cost of another's life. He took this child, this young dragon, across the sea to live secluded in safety from the hunters who would be sent by Tywin Lannister or Robert Baratheon if they knew. I hesitate to believe this, though it would mean much to know something of my sister yet survives in this world. But I am told this child is now grown and gathers allies to him with the aid of powerful friends. Perhaps you've heard that the Golden Company has broken its contract with Myr? They're no doubt complicit.{***}

dlga_doran_8:doran_9|It hurts me even to stand, such is the advanced stage of my sickness. But for this I'll stand. Varys says you're sympathetic to the plight of the realm, and even the injustice visited upon my sister's family. Elia was dear to me, and I'll see her avenged. If the young dragon comes across the Narrow Sea with his army, I'll make sure Dorne is ready to bear arms for him. But he'll need more than allies: he's in desperate need of loyal vassals if he is to reclaim his birthright. Whether for riches or for the good of the realm, you need to muster your strength and prepare to join with him. Aid him against his enemies and you'll have my eternal gratitude. I guarantee that you may be received properly when he reaches Westeros of your intent. Are you prepared for the days ahead?{***}
dlga_doran_9:doran_11|I'm ready to aid the Targaryens in their fight for the Iron Throne!{***}
dlga_doran_9:doran_10|I need time to think about this.{***}
dlga_doran_10:close_window|Very well, but make it quick. We've no time to lose.{***}

dlga_doran_11:close_window|Good, good. I must retire soon as this session has drained me. Know that you've made the right decision. Prepare yourself, gather friends and sharpen blades. When the young king arrives, cast off all prior allegiance and join with him. Take this for your trouble, and know that Dorne will fight alongside you.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.8|You're free to take your leave now, {playername}. Go and prepare, for when the dragon comes, he will show no mercy to his enemies.{***}
dlga_start:doran_9|Well? Have you made up your mind?{***}

dlga_start:ellaria_1|So, you're Varys agent? I'd never expected him to contract someone openly, especially a warrior such as yourself. He's many who serve him, but few walk openly in the light as you do. I'm Ellaria Sand. The message you've brought me is brief but speaks of your reliability. I hope that's the case.{***}
dlga_ellaria_1:ellaria_2|Why do you serve the Spider? For baubles perhaps, or does his talk of serving the realm appeal to your sense of duty?{***}
dlga_ellaria_2:ellaria_3|He speaks of serving the realm, not just whomever sits the throne or himself.{***}
dlga_ellaria_2:ellaria_3.1|He's been a good patron to me so far.{***}

dlga_ellaria_3:ellaria_4|Westeros is torn by war, those who should protect it instead destroy it. I fear dark days are ahead for Dorne if the land should trade wardens for warlords intent on their own enrichment. The North and the Riverlands both strive for their independence, the Lannisters seek to regain control no matter the cost, Stannis fights for dominance whilst the Reach blunders under the direction of Mace Tyrell, and the Vale and the Iron Islands do as they please. These conflicts are a festering wound that needs be cauterized by fire. Only one House has ever managed to unite these desperate lands, and they did so 300 years ago.{***}
dlga_ellaria_4:ellaria_5|The Targaryens - but they're all dead, aren't they?{***}

dlga_ellaria_5:ellaria_6|Not all, no. One remains in the world to my knowledge. Alas, the other one fell victim to a crown of molten gold. She is within reach of contact, and only through a source you and I both know.{***}
dlga_ellaria_6:ellaria_7|Varys?{***}

dlga_ellaria_7:ellaria_8|Varys has been in contact with Daenerys Targaryen. I am told she has gathered an army of Dothraki and Unsullied and plans to sail onto Westeros. We are told she will be first stopping at Dragonstone.{***}

dlga_ellaria_8:ellaria_9|Varys says you're sympathetic to the plight of the realm. If the Dragon Queen comes across the Narrow Sea with her army, Dorne will be ready to bear arms for her. But she will need more than allies: she is in desperate need of loyal vassals if she is to reclaim her birthright. Whether for riches or for the good of the realm, you need to muster your strength and prepare to join with her. I guarantee that you may be received properly when she reaches Westeros of your intent. Are you prepared for the days ahead?{***}
dlga_ellaria_9:ellaria_11|I'm ready to aid the Targaryens in their fight for the Iron Throne!{***}
dlga_ellaria_9:ellaria_10|I need time to think about this.{***}
dlga_ellaria_10:close_window|Very well, but make it quick. We've no time to lose.{***}

dlga_ellaria_11:close_window|Good, good. Know that you've made the right decision. Prepare yourself, gather friends and sharpen blades. When the Dragon Queen arrives, cast off all prior allegiance and join with us. Take this for your trouble, and know that Dorne will fight alongside you.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.9|You're free to take your leave now, {playername}. Go and prepare, for when the Dragon Queen comes, she shall show no mercy to her enemies.{***}
dlga_start:ellaria_9|Well? Have you made up your mind?{***}
dlga_start:fight_alcool1|Hey! Have a drink with me.{***}
dlga_fight_alcool1:fight_alcool2|Sure, why not.{***}
dlga_fight_alcool1:close_window|Sorry, I've no time to pleasure myself with ale.{***}
dlga_fight_alcool1:close_window.1|Go pester someone else, drunkard, before I slash open your windpipe.{***}
dlga_fight_alcool2:fight_alcool3|Well, maybe you would like to invest a few stags in a drinking game?{***}
dlga_fight_alcool3:fight_alcoolstart|A competition? Be warned, you shall not win easily.{***}
dlga_fight_alcool3:close_window|No, thank you.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolstart:fight_alcoolmise|What is your bet?{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend|10 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend.1|20 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend.2|30 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend.3|40 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend.4|50 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseend.5|100 stags.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmise:fight_alcoolmiseendno|OK, I'm finished.{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmiseendno:close_window|Aha...{***}
dlga_fight_alcoolmiseend:fight_begin|First round... together.{***}
dlga_fight_begin:fight_begin2|RHA! that's good , another one!{***}
dlga_fight_begin2:fight_begin_round2|Another.{***}
dlga_fight_begin2:close_window|No more, you win. Bye.{***}
dlga_fight_begin_round2:fight_begin3|Harf!...n..not bad.{***}
dlga_fight_begin3:fight_begin4|Another one!{***}
dlga_fight_begin3:close_window|I've drank too much... bye.{***}
dlga_fight_begin4:fight_begin5|Ha, haha!{***}
dlga_fight_begin4:close_window|I... don't feel well...{***}
dlga_fight_begin5:fight_begin6|Another...{***}
dlga_fight_begin5:close_window|Alright, I'm finished, bye.{***}
dlga_fight_begin6:fight_begin7|Another one! Ahhhh!{***}
dlga_fight_begin6:close_window|...{***}
dlga_fight_begin7:fight_begin8|Ano...ther one, hic...{***}
dlga_fight_begin7:close_window|You're an animal! Keep the stags - you deserve 'em. Another time maybe.{***}
dlga_fight_begin8:close_drunk_f|...{***}
dlga_close_drunk_f:close_window|Thank you for the stags. They'll come in handy.{***}
dlga_start:wildfire_crafter|Greetings, {my King/my Queen}. I can have 9 pots of Substance crafted within the week if you so desire? The cost will be 9,000 silver stags.{***}
dlga_wildfire_crafter:kings_landing_wildfire_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_wildfire_crafter:kings_landing_wildfire_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back once I've spoken to the Master of Coin.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_wildfire_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {my King/my Queen}. I'll no doubt be here once you do.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.10|Greetings, {my King/my Queen}. I'm afraid I need more time and you standing watching is not going to help.{***}
dlga_wildfire_crafter:kings_landing_wildfire_lord_yes1|Yes, Hallyne, that will do fine.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_wildfire_lord_yes1:close_window|Alright, you must leave me now to my work. Please return in 5 days or so and do make sure you have the room to carry them all.{***}

dlga_start:wildfire_crafter.1|Greetings, {my King/my Queen}. Good news, your Substance is ready! Remember, this burns a fire even water cannot extinguish: do be careful. I could start on my next batch if you prefer?{***}
dlga_start:hallyne2|Ah, hello there. I'm Hallyne, head of the Alchemists' Guild. What can I do you for?{***}
dlga_hallyne2:hallyne_do|Hallyne, the Pyromancer? What is it you do here, Hallyne?{***}
dlga_start:hallyne3|Hello again {playername}. What do you need?{***}
dlga_hallyne3:hallyne_do|Please tell me about what you do again.{***}
dlga_hallyne_do:hallyne_do2|Well, I concern myself with the making of the Substance and other fire related matters.{***}
dlga_hallyne_do2:hallyne_do3|The Substance?{***}
dlga_hallyne_do3:hallyne_do4|Yes yes, the Substance. Others may call it Wildfire, but we Pyromancers call it the Substance.{***}
dlga_hallyne_do4:hallyne_do5|How could I obtain this Wildfire?{***}
dlga_hallyne_do5:hallyne3|Well, my {friend/lady}, due to its... erm... let's say volatile nature, only the King himself can instruct me to create such magic for him.{***}
dlga_hallyne3:hallyne_proverb|I remember reading an old sailors' proverb: 'Piss on Wildfire and your cock burns off'.{***}
dlga_hallyne_proverb:hallyne3|Oh! Umm, oh, I've not conducted this experiment. It could very well be true. The Substance burns so hot it burns wood, stone, even steel, and, of course, flesh.{***}
dlga_hallyne3:close_window|Nonetheless, I must leave now.{***}

dlga_start:white_harbour_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some White Harbour Knights? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 10 men. I can have them ready for you in a week.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_lord:white_harbour_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_lord:white_harbour_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.11|Hail and well met, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Unfortunately, the current knights are still in training.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_lord:white_harbour_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then, Ser Bartimus. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:white_harbour_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Your knights are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:white_harbour_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here in White Harbour. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_talk:white_harbour_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_talk1:white_harbour_trainer_talk2|I train White Harbour Knights. The only knights in The North, ya know.{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_talk2:white_harbour_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these Knights of White Harbour?{***}
dlga_white_harbour_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such knights. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:highgarden_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Tyrell House Gaurdsmen? It will cost you 6,000 stags for training and equipping 10 men. I can have them ready for you in a week.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_lord:highgarden_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_lord:highgarden_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.12|Hail and well met, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Unfortunately, the current troops are still in training.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_lord:highgarden_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then, Ser Vortimer. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:highgarden_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Your troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:highgarden_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here in Highgarden. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_talk:highgarden_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_talk1:highgarden_trainer_talk2|I train the Tyrell House Guardsmen. They are the elite troops that protect the head of House Tyrell.{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_talk2:highgarden_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these House troops?{***}
dlga_highgarden_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such valiant soldiers. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:dragonstone_trainer_lord|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Queen's Men? It will cost you 6,000 stags for training and equipping 9 men. I can have them ready for you in a week.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_lord:dragonstone_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_lord:dragonstone_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be here on your return.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.13|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Unfortunately, the current troops are still in training.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_lord:dragonstone_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week, and I'll have your troops at the ready.{***}
dlga_start:dragonstone_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. The Queen's Men are now ready. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:dragonstone_trainer_talk|Greetings, {m'lord/m'lady}. I'm the Master at Arms here at Dragonstone. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_talk:dragonstone_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_talk1:dragonstone_trainer_talk2|I train the Queensguard, highly trained knights sworn to protect the Lord of Dragonstone... whomever that may be at the time.{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_talk2:dragonstone_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire such knights??{***}
dlga_dragonstone_trainer_talk3:close_window|Well, you would need to be Lord of Dragonstone, of course! Anyway, I've much to do, so you best be leaving me to get on with it.{***}

dlga_start:braavos_trainer_lord|Greetings, Sealord {playername}. Do you require the use of a Faceless Man? It will cost you 10,000 silver stags, and he will stay with you for as long as you pay him. It isn't the ordinary way of the Faceless Men, but if the Many-Faced God wills it...{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_lord:braavos_trainer_lord_no|Not just yet.{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_lord:braavos_trainer_lord_no.1|I'm afraid I don't have enough stags at this time.{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_lord_no:close_window|Alright, {your Lordship/my Lady}.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.14|Good greetings, Sealord {playername}. I've to apologize, but the Faceless Man hasn't arrived yet.{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_lord:braavos_trainer_lord_yes1|Yes, I could use the use of an assassin. Send for one right away.{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Of course, Sealord {playername}. Come back and see me in a couple of days. Hopefully he'll have arrived by then.{***}
dlga_start:braavos_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, Sealord {playername}. The Faceless Man has arrived. Do you wish for me to send for any more?{***}
dlga_start:braavos_trainer_talk|Greetings, {ser/madam}. They call me the Kindly Man, though the assassins under my control are anything but kind.{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_talk:braavos_trainer_talk1|Assassins you say?{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_talk1:braavos_trainer_talk2|You've never heard of the Faceless Men?!{***}
dlga_braavos_trainer_talk2:braavos_trainer_talk3|Hmm, the Faceless Men? And I could have you kill anyone I want?{***}

dlga_braavos_trainer_talk3:close_window|You must know: we don't kill to serve some lord, to fatten our purses, or merely to stroke our vanity. We never give the gift to please ourselves. Nor do we choose the ones we kill. We're but servants of the Many-Faced God. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:pyke_trainer_lord|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Kraken Guards? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping ten men. I can have them ready for you in a week.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_lord:pyke_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_lord:pyke_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting for your return.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.15|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. As much as I'd like to inform you of the opposite, but the Kraken Guards are still in training.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_lord:pyke_trainer_lord_yes1|Yes, train me some good men.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:pyke_trainer_lord.1|The Kraken Guards are now ready, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:pyke_trainer_talk|I'm the Master at Arms here at Pyke. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_talk:pyke_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_talk1:pyke_trainer_talk2|I train the Kraken Guards. The best of all the Ironborn I'll have you know!{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_talk2:pyke_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these Kraken Guards you speak so highly of?{***}
dlga_pyke_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this town can request the training of such valiant warriors. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {ser/madam}.{***}

dlga_start:kings_landing_trainer_lord|Pleasures metting you, {my King/my Queen}. Do you require me to train you some Gold Cloaks for the city guard? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 15 of them. The new troops can be ready within a week.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_trainer_lord:kings_landing_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_trainer_lord:kings_landing_trainer_lord_no.1|It seems my coffers are empty. I'll have to come back once I've spoken to the Master of Coin.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {my King/my Queen}. I'll be waiting here for your return.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.16|Good greetings, {my King/my Queen}, I'm afraid your Gold Cloaks are still training.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_trainer_lord:kings_landing_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you'd best get to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_kings_landing_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Oh, of course, {my King/my Queen}. I'll have the troops ready within the week.{***}
dlga_start:kings_landing_trainer_lord.1|Good greetings, {my King/my Queen}. The Gold Cloaks are now ready to help bolster the city guard. Do you require me to train any more?{***}
dlga_start:close_window.17|I'm Janos Slynt, the Commander of the City Guard here in King's Landing. Don't you be causing no problems, {lad/lass}.{***}

dlga_start:bolton_trainer_lord|{Your Lordship/My Lady}, do you require me to start training some Bolton levies? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 40 men. I can have them ready for you in a couple of weeks.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_lord:bolton_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_lord:bolton_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_lord:bolton_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a couple of weeks, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:bolton_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Your troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:bolton_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here at the Dreadfort. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_talk:bolton_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_talk1:bolton_trainer_talk2|I train troops specific to House Bolton.{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_talk2:bolton_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these Bolton troops?{***}
dlga_bolton_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this castle can request the training of such troops. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:stark_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Stark levies? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 40 men. I can have them ready for you in a couple of weeks.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_lord:stark_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_lord:stark_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_lord:stark_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week or two, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:stark_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Your troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:stark_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here in Winterfell. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_talk:stark_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_talk1:stark_trainer_talk2|I train troops specific to House Stark.{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_talk2:stark_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these troops?{***}
dlga_stark_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such troops. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:karstark_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Karstark levies? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 40 men. I can have them ready for you in a couple of weeks.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_lord:karstark_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_lord:karstark_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_lord:karstark_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week or two, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:karstark_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. The troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:karstark_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here at castle Karhold. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_talk:karstark_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_talk1:karstark_trainer_talk2|I train troops specific to House Karstark.{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_talk2:karstark_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these troops?{***}
dlga_karstark_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such troops. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:frey_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Frey levies? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 40 men. I can have them ready for you in a couple of weeks.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_lord:frey_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_lord:frey_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_lord:frey_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week or two, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:frey_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. The troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:frey_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here at the Twins. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_talk:frey_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_talk1:frey_trainer_talk2|I train troops specific to House Frey.{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_talk2:frey_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these troops?{***}
dlga_frey_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such troops. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}

dlga_start:lannister_trainer_lord|Good greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Do you require me to train you some Lannister levies? It will cost you 5,000 stags for training and equipping 40 men. I can have them ready for you in a couple of weeks.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_lord:lannister_trainer_lord_no|Not at the moment.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_lord:lannister_trainer_lord_no.1|It looks like the coffers are bare. I'll have to come back later.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_lord_no:close_window|As you wish, {your Lordship/my Lady}. I'll be waiting here if you do.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_lord:lannister_trainer_lord_yes1|I suggest you best get back to work then. I trust you'll train them well.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_lord_yes1:close_window|Yes, of course, {your Lordship/my Lady}. Come back and see me in a week or two, and I'll have your troops ready for you.{***}
dlga_start:lannister_trainer_lord.1|Greetings, {your Lordship/my Lady}. The troops are ready now. Do you require me to train you any more?{***}
dlga_start:lannister_trainer_talk|Good greetings, {ser/madam}. I'm the Master at Arms here at Casterly Rock. I train the troops required by the current lord.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_talk:lannister_trainer_talk1|What sort of troops can you train here?{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_talk1:lannister_trainer_talk2|I train troops specific to House Lannister.{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_talk2:lannister_trainer_talk3|So, how could I acquire these troops?{***}
dlga_lannister_trainer_talk3:close_window|Only the lord of this city can request the training of such troops. Speaking of which, I've a job to do. Good day, {playername}.{***}
dlga_start:innkeeper_1_talk|Greetings, I'm Sharna. Welcome to the Inn of the Kneeling Man, {ser/lady}.{***}
dlga_innkeeper_1_talk:close_window|Nice to meet you, Sharna.{***}
dlga_innkeeper_1_talk:close_window.1|Right.{***}
dlga_start:innkeeper_talk_2|What ho, {lad/lassie}. I'm the innkeeper here at the Old Stone Bridge.{***}
dlga_innkeeper_talk_2:close_window|No shit?{***}
dlga_innkeeper_talk_2:close_window.1|No shit.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.18|What of ya? Just mindin' me own business an' havin' a drink, {lad/lassie}.{***}
dlga_start:innkeeper_1_talk.1|How fare you? I'm the owner of this establishment. Hey, aren't you the one who saved us from those Wildlings?{***}
dlga_innkeeper_1_talk:innkeeper_2_talk|Oh me? It was nothing.{***}
dlga_innkeeper_1_talk:close_window.2|Actually yeah. But who's going to save you from me, eh?!{***}
dlga_innkeeper_2_talk:close_window|We all appreciate your help. Feel free to rest here whenever you need, {lad/lass}.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.19|Can't you see I'm busy.{***}
dlga_start:tavern_npc2_talk|How fares it, {ser/madam}? What can I do for you?{***}
dlga_tavern_npc2_talk:tavern_npc2_talk_2|Well met, I'm looking for information on who owns this establishment.{***}
dlga_tavern_npc2_talk_2:tavern_npc2_talk_3|That would be me, {ser/madam}. My name's Masha Heddle. My grandfather used to own this place before me. {***}
dlga_tavern_npc2_talk_3:tavern_npc2_talk_4|Oh, I see. How long has this place been here?{***}
dlga_tavern_npc2_talk_3:close_window|Alright, thank you. That's all I needed to know.{***}

dlga_tavern_npc2_talk_4:tavern_npc2_talk_5|This inn has stood here a very long time, since Jaehaerys I, in fact. It's had many names: The Two Crowns, The Bellringer Inn, and the Clanking Dragon. People from all over Westeros visit here. If you need to find someone, then this is where they would probably be.{***}
dlga_tavern_npc2_talk_5:close_window|Sounds good, thank you.{***}
dlga_start:local_traveller_talk|Well met, {ser/madam}.{***}
dlga_local_traveller_talk:local_traveller_talk_2|Well met, who are you?{***}

dlga_local_traveller_talk_2:local_traveller_talk_3|Me? Why? I'm just a mere traveller. Westeros, Essos, I've travelled all over the known world. If I were to know you better, I'd have some secrets I could tell you. Ha, but never mind about that, {ser/madam}.{***}

dlga_local_traveller_talk_2:close_window|Me? Why? I'm just a mere traveller, {ser/madam}. Westeros, Essos, I've travelled all over the known world. If I were to know you better, I'd have some secrets I could tell. Ha, but never mind about that.{***}
dlga_local_traveller_talk_3:local_traveller_talk_4|I could guarantee good things if you were tell me your 'secrets'...{***}

dlga_local_traveller_talk_4:local_traveller_talk_5|Ha, well, you're a persuasive character, aren't you?! Very well. Whilst travelling to Qohor, I met a weaponsmith who could reforge Valyrian blades. I can't quite remember his name though.{***}
dlga_local_traveller_talk_5:local_traveller_talk_6|Anything else?{***}
dlga_local_traveller_talk_5:close_window|Sounds good, I'll have to go visit this weaponsmith sometime, eh. Thanks.{***}
dlga_local_traveller_talk_6:close_window|Ha ,you're not that persuasive, {ser/madam}.{***}
dlga_start:tavern_npc3_talk|Hic... hell..lo, {ser/madam}.{***}
dlga_tavern_npc3_talk:tavern_npc3_talk_2|Umm, hello...{***}
dlga_tavern_npc3_talk_2:close_window|My w...w...ifes gon... kill me. Burps!{***}
dlga_start:close_window.20|Leave me be. I'm not here to talk!{***}
dlga_start:gambler_talk|Hail fellow well met, my {friend/lady}. Maybe you fancy trying your luck?{***}
