dlga_gambler_talk:tavern_tk_3cards|Sure, why not.{***}
dlga_gambler_talk:close_window|No, thanks.{***}
dlga_tavern_tk_3cards:close_window|Alright, the rules are simple. Find the Lady and you win, if not, you lose.{***}
dlga_tavern_tk_3cards:close_window.1|I guess you can't: you don't have enough coins, {lad/lassie}.{***}
dlga_start:ruined_quest_menu|Good day {ser/lady}. You look like someone well travelled. Do you want to hear a story?{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_menu:ruined_quest_yes|I have plenty of time. Sure, why not.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_menu:ruined_quest_no|No thanks, I'm busy.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_yes:ruined_quest_story|Ah good! Well, I'm Ser Janis Lyren. My family go way back when, to Valyria, ya know. Well Lord Petyr Lyren, my father god rest his soul, used to tell me all sorts of my ancestry.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_no:close_window|As you wish {my lord/my lady}.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_story:ruined_quest_story1|It so happens we used to have a home, a castle in fact somewhere near Essos. No idea where it is now mind. But I wouldn't mind finding it! My poor father passed away some time ago now and all his memories with him.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_story1:ruined_quest_story_choice|I've been waiting here in the hope someone will help me find it. I want nothing for it mind, just to allow me to live out the rest of my days there. The castle can be yours, just look after it with pride is all I say. Agree and I will help you search for it.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_story_choice:ruined_quest_choice_yes|Sounds interesting. What do you have in mind? Any idea where to start looking?{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_story_choice:ruined_quest_choice_no|This all seems very fascinating, but I'm way too busy for such an expedition. Maybe some other time.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_choice_yes:ruined_quest_choice_yes1_new|Well, here's the thing, all I know is it's near Essos. Oh, and it's in ruins, did I forget to mention that part? Anyhow we will need tools, at least 50 men and possibly around 10k stags. It's a lot to ask I know. But if we do find it, then you have a castle for yourself and I can rest knowing I have fulfilled my fathers dream.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_choice_yes1_new:ruined_quest_choice_yes1|We should probably acquire a ship too, no telling where this place could be. Oh and don't forget to stock up on supplies and bring some good men. It could be a long and dangerous expedition.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_choice_no:close_window|Ah, fair enough. I'll possibly still be here should you change your mind.{***}

dlga_ruined_quest_choice_yes1:ruined_quest_choice_yes2|As soon as you're ready we can leave. Though don't be waiting too long, someone else may well pass who's in the need of a castle to call home.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_choice_yes2:close_window|Ok let's go.{***}
dlga_ruined_quest_choice_yes2:close_window.1|This all seems too much. I think I'm going to pass, but thanks.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.21|Good day {ser/my lady}.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu|Well, it does my art good to see you, good {ser/madam}.{***}
dlga_measter_menu:pycelle1|Well met. What's your story, old man?{***}
dlga_pycelle1:pycelle2|I'm the Grand Maester of the Citadel here in King's Landing. I've mastered the study of the higher mysteries. You know, not a lot of maesters can boast about that.{***}
dlga_pycelle2:close_window|I must leave.{***}
dlga_pycelle2:pycelle3|A man of your .. stature must have served many Kings?{***}
dlga_pycelle3:pycelle4|A man of your .. stature must have served many Kings?{***}

dlga_pycelle4:pycelle5|Oh, I can tell you all there is to know about Kings. The thing you need to understand about Kings is... For the past 67 years, I've known... truly known more Kings than any man alive. They're complicated men, but I know how to serve them. Yes. And keep on serving them. Aerys Targaryen... of all the thousand maladies the Gods visit on us, madness is the worst. He was a good man, such a charmer. To watch him melt away before my eyes, consumed by dreams of fire and blood.{***}

dlga_pycelle5:pycelle6|Robert Baratheon was an entirely different animal... powerful man, a great warrior... but alas, winning a kingdom and ruling a kingdom are rather different things. They say that if a man goes through life with his battle visor down, he can often be blind to the enemies at his side. Now I serve a new King, may the Gods bless his reign. But I sense true greatness on the horizon for our new King. True greatness.{***}
dlga_pycelle6:pycelle7|So what's the thing?{***}
dlga_pycelle7:pycelle8|What thing?{***}
dlga_pycelle8:pycelle9|About Kings. You said, the thing you need to understand about Kings...{***}
dlga_pycelle9:pycelle10|What? Things? What?{***}
dlga_pycelle10:close_window|When you started, you... never mind.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.1|How can I be of help to you, {ser/madam}?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:npc32_2|Is that a Valyrian steel link you're wearing?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window|I must leave now.{***}
dlga_npc32_2:npc32_3|Ah, yes, maesters are awarded the link for their involvement in the learning of magic.{***}
dlga_npc32_3:npc32_4|Do you believe magic still exists?{***}

dlga_npc32_4:close_window|Oh, of course not. Magic was once a mighty force in the world, but not any longer. What little remains is no more than the wisp of smoke that lingers in the air after a great fire has burned out, and even that is fading away. Valyria was the last ember, and it's gone forever.{***}
dlga_start:hodor_talk|Hodor!{***}
dlga_hodor_talk:hodor_talk_2|Are you ok??{***}
dlga_hodor_talk_2:hodor_talk_3|Hodor!{***}
dlga_hodor_talk_3:close_window|Mhm...{***}
dlga_start:hodor_talk.1|Do you want to fly? Yes, lets make you fly...{***}
dlga_hodor_talk:hodor_talk_2.1|No thanks.{***}
dlga_hodor_talk_2:hodor_talk_3.1|Well, I'm Lord of the Vale and I can make anyone fly. Wooosh right through the moon door.{***}
dlga_hodor_talk_3:close_window.1|I gotta go.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.22|Do you enjoy staring at a dwarf!?{***}
dlga_start:close_window.23|Do you support the Lord of Light, dear {boy/girl}?{***}

dlga_start:miss1|You stand in the presence on Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryan, rightful heir to the Iron Throne, the rightful Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms, Mother of Dragons, the Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, the Unburnt, the Breaker of Chains.{***}
dlga_miss1:close_window|I am {playername}.{***}
dlga_miss1:miss2|Tell me a joke.{***}
dlga_miss2:miss3|Two translators are on a sinking ship. The first says, Do you know how to swim? The second says, No, but I can shout for help in 19 languages.{***}
dlga_miss3:close_window|That is the worst joke I ever heard.{***}
dlga_start:aemon_menu|My {lord/lady}, how art thou? To whom do I have the pleasure of speaking with?{***}
dlga_aemon_menu:npc36_2|What cheer, maester? My name's {playername}.{***}
dlga_aemon_menu:npc36_4|Mind your own business, old man!{***}
dlga_aemon_menu:close_window|Sorry, I've to leave.{***}
dlga_npc36_2:measter_menu|And what is it I can do you for, {playername}?{***}
dlga_npc36_4:close_window|...{***}
dlga_measter_menu:npc36_ww|What have you heard about these White Walkers?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:npc36_nw|Can you tell me how to join the Night's Watch?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.1|Sorry, I've to leave.{***}
dlga_npc36_ww:measter_menu|Hmm... you know, the Starks are always right eventually: 'winter is coming'. This one will be long, and dark things will come with it.{***}
dlga_npc36_nw:npc36_nw2|You cannot simply join the Night's Watch, dear friend. You should speak to {s1} if your request is sincere.{***}
dlga_npc36_nw2:measter_menu|Alright, thank you.{***}

dlga_npc36_nw:npc36_nw3|I'm afraid it's too late, friend. The Night's Watch have already been defeated: the shield has been shattered. We must now pray to all the gods in the hope someone will save the realms of men.{***}
dlga_npc36_nw3:close_window|...{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.2|Pleasures meeting you. I'm the maester here at Dragonstone. Anything I can do for you?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:pylos_2|What can you tell me about this dreary place?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.2|No, thank you.{***}
dlga_pylos_2:pylos_3|Ah, Dragonstone. It's built on an active volcano called Dragonmont. Unfortunately yes, this means this rock is wet, cold, and very dreary.{***}
dlga_pylos_3:pylos_4|Please, carry on.{***}
dlga_pylos_3:close_window|OK, I've heard enough.{***}

dlga_pylos_4:pylos_5|Oh, of course. Dragonstone was built by the Targaryens almost five centuries ago. They did employ an entire army of masons and labourers to raise these stones atop the cliffs. Some of the more simple minded think they resorted to magic, but, beside the fact that every fool could build a castle having that labour force at hand, that's mostly because the used building techniques have been lost to the ages: those simpletons call everything magic they don't understand.{***}

dlga_pylos_5:close_window|But I get off the point. Dragonstone is the largest of the Valyrian strongholds to survive the cataclysm we call the Doom. Ah, there are so many things I could tell you. Do you know there are still many obsidian deposits in the tunnels below the mountain?!{***}
dlga_start:petyr1|Have a good day, and who are you?{***}
dlga_petyr1:petyr2|Littlefinger to most, an amusing nickname, don't you think?{***}
dlga_petyr2:petyr3|Possibly.{***}
dlga_petyr2:petyr4|Pahaha! Littlefinger?! I'll bet that's not the only thing little about you!{***}

dlga_petyr3:close_window|It was given to me by a Tully boy, rather creative back in his day. He chose it for me because of my size, that and the fact I grew up on the smallest peninsula of the Vale. The name was cruel enough to stick, but I've grown rather fond of it.{***}
dlga_petyr4:close_window|Mock me all you want, dear {boy/girl}. But just remember this: I always get what I want, so please be careful.{***}

dlga_event_triggered:wildling_farm|You think you can make a difference?! You can't! Winter's coming... and those things with it... stay this side of the wall unless you want to be taken by the cold!{***}
dlga_wildling_farm:wildling_farm2|You watch as the wildling takes his last few breaths...{***}
dlga_wildling_farm2:close_window|You must take this news to King Robb right away. He may have use of it.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.3|I've not seen you before.{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.3|Very good, I need to go. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.4|I'm the maester here at Eastwatch.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.5|Greetings, I'm the maester here at Shadow Tower.{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.4|Very good, I need to go. Fare thee well.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.6|Hail and well met, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Wendamyr.{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.5|Very good, I need to go. Goodbye.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.7|Have a good day, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Gormon.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.8|Greetings, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Theomore.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.9|Hail and well met, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Gulian.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.10|Have a good day, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Myles.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.11|Good greetings, my {lord/lady}. I'm Maester Tybald.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.12|Good greetings, my {lord/lady}.{***}
dlga_start:nan_1|Maybe you would like to hear a story?{***}
dlga_nan_1:nan_2|Sure.{***}
dlga_nan_1:close_window|No thanks.{***}

dlga_nan_2:close_window|Beyond the Wall the monsters live, the giants and the ghouls, the stalking shadows and the dead that walk, but they cannot pass so long as the Wall stands strong and the men of the Night's Watch are true.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.24|{playername}. Can you not see I'm busy.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.25|Greetings, {ser/madam}. It seems it has not yet been a week. I'm too busy right now, please come back later.{***}
dlga_start:citadel_back_training|Ah {playername}. You are back to finish learning.{***}
dlga_citadel_back_training:citadel_back_training1|(You show the maester what you have learnt and after several hours you feel more and more comfortable reading){***}
dlga_citadel_back_training1:close_window|Well done {playername}. I thought we would never get there! Now go read something and get out of my way.{***}

dlga_start:citadel_trainer_talk|Greetings, {ser/madam}. If you have something to say, please make it quick. I'm half way through the Annals of the Black Centaur and I would rather like to get it finished.{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk:citadel_trainer_talk1|I would like to learn how to read. Maybe you would be able to teach me?{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk1:citadel_trainer_talk2|Hmm, (he looks you up and down) I'm not sure you have the correct, how to say, demeanour?{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk2:citadel_trainer_talk3|OK, I tell you what, pay me 2500 stags and I will see what I can do with you. Though I can see this will be no easy feat.{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk3:close_window|Actually, I would rather not.{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk3:close_window.1|It looks like I cannot afford that.{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_talk3:citadel_trainer_yes|Sure, here take it.{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_yes:citadel_trainer_yes1|Ok good! (he starts teaching you how to read).{***}
dlga_citadel_trainer_yes1:close_window|Now, remember what you have learnt, keep practising and come back and see me in a week. I think then you will be ready for your next lesson.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.26|I'm the Lord Commander of the city watch.{***}
dlga_start:measter_menu.13|Hello, I am the maester here at {s9}. How can I help you?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:healing_option|Could you take a look at my injuries, maester?{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.6|I shall leave you to your work, maester.{***}
dlga_healing_option:healing_major|Hmm, your injuries are worse than I thought, my {lord/lady}. Would you like me to heal them? It will cost {reg1} stags.{***}
dlga_healing_option:healing_major_lord|My {lord/lady}. Your injuries are worse than I thought. Would you like me to heal you? It will cost {reg1} stags.{***}
dlga_healing_option:healing_minor|It seems you've a minor injury, my {lord/lady}. Would you like me to heal it? That will cost {reg1} stags.{***}
dlga_healing_option:healing_minor_lord|My {lord/lady}. It seems you've a minor injury, would you like me to heal you? For you it will cost {reg1} stags.{***}
dlga_healing_option:measter_menu|It looks as though you have no injuries, my {lord/lady}.{***}
dlga_healing_minor:healing_minor_yes|Sure, go ahead.{***}
dlga_healing_minor:measter_menu|Actually I've changed my mind.{***}
dlga_healing_minor:measter_menu.1|Bugger, it seems I can't afford your services.{***}

dlga_healing_minor_yes:healing_minor_finished|Here we go, just let me clamp that artery... careful... ups, sorry, that little bugger slipped away. Hand me over that pair of forceps, quickly... almost got it... ah, yes, as good as new.{***}
dlga_healing_minor_finished:measter_menu|Thank you, maester, I feel better already.{***}
dlga_healing_minor_lord:healing_minor_yes_lord|Sure, go ahead.{***}
dlga_healing_minor_lord:measter_menu|Actually I've changed my mind.{***}
dlga_healing_minor_lord:measter_menu.1|Damn, it seems I can't afford your services.{***}
dlga_healing_minor_yes_lord:healing_minor_finished|Well then, just let me wash and bandage those wounds, actually no real challenge for a maester like myself. Ah, there you go.{***}
dlga_healing_major:healing_major_yes|Sure, go ahead.{***}
dlga_healing_major:measter_menu|Actually I've changed my mind.{***}
dlga_healing_major:measter_menu.1|Damn it, it seems I can't afford your services.{***}

dlga_healing_major_yes:healing_major_finished|Well, are you sure you don't want some milk of the poppy? This cut looks really nasty. Ah, here you can clearly see where the bone was fractured. This will hurt now, my {lord/lady}. Don't move! I've to clamp that artery before I cut here... yes, you're taking it like a true warrior, just a bit longer... fuck, that wasn't supposed to happen... wait, wait, wait, no need to panic. Quick, give me those red-hot pliers! Don't slip on that pool of blood... now close your eyes and think about something beautiful... ah, learning never stops. You're as good as new, my {lord/lady}.{***}
dlga_healing_major_finished:measter_menu|Thank you very much, maester. I feel better already.{***}
dlga_healing_major_lord:healing_major_yes_lord|Sure, go ahead.{***}
dlga_healing_major_lord:measter_menu|Actually I've changed my mind.{***}
dlga_healing_major_lord:measter_menu.1|Damn, it seems I can't afford your services.{***}

dlga_healing_major_yes_lord:healing_major_finished|Alright, my {lord/lady}. Are you really sure you don't want some milk of the poppy? It's your decision. Let me take a look at that wound now. Ah, you should've visited me earlier: it's already festering. But no reason to be alarmed. I simply have to cut away the foul flesh. Now take a deep breath, my {lord/lady}... ah, that cut was a bit too deep! I should have known better than cutting so close to an artery. Quick, boy, fetch me those pliers and that little phial over there. Come on, this is serious! My {lord/lady}, can you hear me? Stay with me! Boy, I told you to be quick... ah, by the Seven, you're awake. That was pretty close, my {lord/lady}. Next time you shouldn't really wait that long before you consult a maester.{***}
dlga_measter_menu:close_window.7|I have to go now.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.27|Mind yourself within the manse.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.28|You like big tits, my {lord/lady}? I would suggest Ros is your girl.{***}

dlga_start:close_window.29|Welcome to this fine house. All sorts of pleasures await you here, my {lord/lady}. Do you want one girl, two, or even three? Do you like them small or big, hairy or shaved? Or perhaps you prefer a boy? No wish remains unfulfilled here. One of our girls can even perform a Meereenese Knot. If you've never tasted these exotic pleasures, you haven't lived at all. Come and enjoy life within the walls of this brothel, my {lord/lady}.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.30|Welcome to the Peach, my {lord/lady}. You've come seeking the finest whores in Westeros? You should be glad you've come to the right place.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.31|Welcome to the Happy Port, my {lord/lady}. Please take your pick of our fine girls here. You won't be disappointed.{***}
dlga_start:ramun_introduce_1|Good day to you, {young man/lassie}.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_1:ramun_introduce_2|What's a man wearing the black doing so far south of the Wall?{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_1:close_window|Never mind.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_2:ramun_introduce_3|I'm Yoren, a sworn brother of the Night's Watch. I wander the Seven Kingdoms in hope of finding men to fill our ranks.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_3:ramun_introduce_4|A Wandering Crow?{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_4:ramun_introduce_5|Aye, a Wandering Crow. The lines are running thin these days, and we need all the men we can get.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_5:ramun_introduce_6|So... you roam the Seven Kingdoms collaring pickpockets and horse thieves and take them back to the wall as eager recruits?{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_6:ramun_introduce_7|Aye. Well, it's not all of 'em done bad things.  Some of 'em just poor lads looking for steady feed. Some of 'em highborn lads looking for glory.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_7:ramun_introduce_8|And why would they join the Watch?{***}

dlga_ramun_introduce_8:ramun_introduce_9|Mostly in return for sanction for crimes they've committed.  Some of 'em even volunteer to join the Night's Watch.  The Wall's lines are becoming thinner each day, because of this I would be willing to offer a small fee for any prisoners you may have.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_9:ramun_introduce_10|Hmm, a small fee? {***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_10:ramun_introduce_11|Aye, a few silver stags for each head you bring me, alive of course. The Watch don't much care who they are or where they come from.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_11:ramun_introduce_12|Hmm, I'll think about it.{***}
dlga_ramun_introduce_12:close_window|Good. Come back and see me when you've made up ya mind. The more men the better, there's been strange rumours of late from beyond the Wall.{***}
dlga_start:ramun_talk|Hail fellow well met, {playername}.{***}
dlga_ramun_pre_talk:ramun_talk|Anything else?{***}
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_sell_prisoners|I have some prisoners you can take.{***}
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners:ramun_sell_prisoners_2|Are you sure you want to hand them all over?{***}
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners_2:ramun_sell_prisoners_3|I am sure.{***}
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners_2:ramun_talk|On second thoughts, no.{***}
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners_3:close_window|Thanks, my {lad/lassie} the Night's Watch betters due to your contributions.{***}
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_ask_about_capturing|How did you come to join the Night's Watch?{***}

dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing:ramun_have_blunt_weapon|New to this, aren't ya? Lemme explain it in simple terms. The basic rule of takin' someone prisoner is knockin' 'em down with a blunt weapon, like a mace or a club, rather than cuttin' 'em open with a sword. That way 'em go to sleep for a little while rather than bleeding to death, ya see? I'm assumin' ya've a blunt weapon with ya, {lad/lassie}.{***}
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes|Of course.{***}
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no|As a matter of fact, I don't.{***}

dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes:ramun_ask_about_capturing_2|Good. Then all ya need to do is beat those bastards down with ya weapon, and when the fightin's over ya clamp 'em in irons. It's a bit different for nobles and such, 'em tend to be protected enough that it won't matter what kind of weapon ya use, but ya average rabble-rousers will bleed like a stuck pig if ya get 'em with somethin' sharp, and a dead rabble-rouser is no good to anyone.{***}

dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no_2|No? Heh, well, this must be ya lucky day, {lad/lassie}. I've got an old club here ya can use. It's a bit battered, but still good enough to bludgeon someone until he stops movin'. Here, take it.{***}
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no_2:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes|Thanks, Yoren. Perhaps I may try my hand at it.{***}
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing:ramun_ask_about_capturing_2|I was young, saw my brother stabbed through the heart right on our doorstep. Weren't much of a villain, the man who stabbed him.{***}
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_2:ramun_ask_about_capturing_3|You knew who it was?{***}

dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_3:ramun_ask_about_capturing_4|Willem, the last name was. He ran off before anyone could spit. And I just stood there, watchin' my brother die. Here's the funny part. I can't picture my brother's face any more, but Willem, oh, he's a nice-lookin' lad: good white teeth, blue eyes, one of those dimpled chins the lassies like.{***}
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_4:ramun_ask_about_capturing_5|......{***}

dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_5:ramun_ask_about_capturing_6|I would think about him when I was workin',  when I was drinkin', when I was havin' a shit. It got to the point where I would say his name every night before I went to bed.   Willem, Willem, Willem... a prayer almost. Well, one day, Willem came ridin' back into town, and I buried an axe so deep into his skull, they'd to bury him with it. Willem's horse got me to the Wall, and I've been wearin' the black ever since.{***}
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_6:ramun_ask_about_capturing_7|... and then you became a wandering crow?{***}
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_7:ramun_pre_talk|An injury to the shoulder. They said I couldn't longer fight well! So, for the past 30 years I've been recruiting for my brothers instead.{***}
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_leave|I'd better be going.{***}
dlga_ramun_leave:close_window|Remember, any prisoners ya've got, bring 'em to me and the watch will be grateful for it.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.32|I humbly request that your Lordship keeps his hands where I can see them.{***}
dlga_manhunters_attack_1:manhunter_talk_b|{s4}{***}
dlga_start:manhunter_talk_b|Oi, you there! You've seen any outlaws around here?{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b:manhunter_talk_b1|Ah, the Brotherhood without Banners? Yes, they went this way some time ago.{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b1:close_window|I knew it! Come on, lads! Let's go get these bastards! Thanks a lot, friend.{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b:manhunter_talk_b2|No, haven't seen any outlaws lately.{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b2:close_window|Bah. They're holed up in this country like rats, but we'll smoke them out sooner or later.{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b:manhunter_talk_b4|You'll get nothing out of me, scum!{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b4:close_window|A good day as any to die eh?!{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b:manhunter_talk_b1close|Good luck. Farewell.{***}
dlga_manhunter_talk_b1close:close_window|Farewell.{***}
dlga_looters_1:looters_2|{s4}{***}
dlga_looters_2:close_window|I'm not afraid of you lot. Fight me if you dare!{***}
dlga_looters_2:close_window.1|You'll have nothing of mine but cold steel, scum.{***}

dlga_start:village_farmer_talk| My {lord/lady}, we're only poor farmers from the village of {s11}. {reg1?We are taking our products to the market at {s12}.:We are returning from the market at {s12} back to our village.}{***}
dlga_village_farmer_talk:farmer_bandit_information|I've been hunting a group of bandits with the following description... Have you seen them?{***}
dlga_farmer_bandit_information:village_farmer_talk|{s15}{***}
dlga_village_farmer_talk:close_window|We'll see how poor you are after I take what you've got!{***}
dlga_village_farmer_talk:close_window.1|Carry on, then. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:fisher_talk|My {reg59?lady:lord}, we're only poor fishermen from {s11}.{***}
dlga_fisher_talk:close_window|We'll see how poor you are after I take what you've got!{***}
dlga_fisher_talk:fisher_talk_1|Is fishing important for {s11}?{***}
dlga_fisher_talk:close_window.1|Carry on, then. Farewell.{***}
dlga_fisher_talk_1:fisher_talk_2|{s11} has a {s21} fishing fleet. Usually we {s22}produce enough salt to preserve the fish the fleet brings to port.{***}
dlga_fisher_talk_2:close_window|Very well. That's all I wanted to know.{***}
dlga_start:relikwias|You! My Unsullied... all... slain!{***}
dlga_relikwias:relikwia2s|- You walk up to the Good Master -{***}
dlga_relikwia2s:relikwia3s|Wha... what are you doing?! No! Please...{***}
dlga_relikwia3s:close_window|- You cut his throat and watch the blood dampen his clothes while he struggles desperately to stop the bleeding. -{***}
dlga_start:order21|You should have stayed at the tavern.{***}
dlga_order21:order31|Someone must stop you.{***}
dlga_order31:order41|It's too late!{***}
dlga_order41:close_window|So be it!{***}
dlga_order2:close_window|Good luck.{***}
dlga_start:pj_talk|What do you want?.{***}
dlga_npc18_pretalk:pj_talk|Yes?{***}
dlga_pj_talk:close_window|No matter, I'm leaving.{***}
dlga_pj_talk:pj_talk2|Hello, who are you? You were not born in the Seven Kingdoms, that I can tell.{***}
dlga_pj_talk2:pj_talk3|I'm a Good Master. My homeland Astopor is located in Southern Essos.{***}
dlga_pj_talk3:pj_talk4|Southern Essos? Have you tried the beer here? - You shout the maid for two beers -{***}
dlga_pj_talk4:close_window|Pah, you can't even afford the price of a beer, let alone the price of my soldiers!{***}

dlga_pj_talk4:pj_talkcado|Yes. Astopor is a City situated in Slaver's Bay. I'm here on business. You may have noticed Qohor's city guard is made up of Unsullied? Proper warriors, not like here, where you're nothing more than little girls. - The Good Master laughs. -The Unsullied are trained from birth, and only one out of four survives to become a soldier: the weak die while the strong go on to live a life of no feelings, no fear of death, and no morals. Before their training ends, they're ordered to kill a child to help them forget all humanity. They're renowned for their utter discipline on the battlefield.{***}
dlga_pj_talkcado:pj_talk5|All Unsullied are slaves and can be traded.{***}
dlga_pj_talk3:close_window|Very good, but I must leave. Farewell.{***}
dlga_pj_talk5:pj_talk6|Haha, little girls!? Your castrated slave scum is no match for my men!{***}
dlga_pj_talk5:pj_talk6.1|You are mad!{***}
dlga_pj_talk5:pj_talk71|I would like to hire some Unsullied.{***}
dlga_pj_talk6:cado_bye|You dare to insult me?! You'll now pay for your misdeeds!{***}
dlga_pj_talk71:close_window|Come back when I've had the time to train more Unsullied.{***}

dlga_pj_talk71:pj_dilema|Yes. But remember: the Unsullied are elite troops, trained from childhood to be ruthless and efficient warriors. If you want, I can trade you a small company of 50 men, but you must pay me 75,000 silver stags. Alright?{***}
dlga_pj_dilema:close_window|Hmm, I was merely curious. Farewell.{***}
dlga_pj_dilema:close_window.1|Hmm, It seems I'm unable to lead any more men.{***}
dlga_pj_dilema:pj_dilema2|Sure. Take the money. I'm eager to see them in battle.{***}
dlga_pj_dilema2:close_window|Come back when you've some coin to spend, beggar!{***}

dlga_pj_dilema2:cado_bye2|Remember this is important: these men will swear fealty to you and protect you with their lives.They'll follow any order, even if it sends them to their death.The Unsullied are excellent warriors, and you won't find any other soldiers like them.{***}
dlga_cado_bye2:close_window|It's an honour to have a company of such valiant soldiers under my command. Farewell.{***}
dlga_cado_bye:close_window|Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.33|Noon, {knave/wench}. I'll deal with you then...{***}
dlga_start:geoffrey_duelling|You've come to meet your doom, {knave/wench}. The Drowned God, I'm sure, will see to this one!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_duelling:close_window|Let's get this over with...{***}
dlga_start:geoffrey_talk_new|Ah, {playername}. It's good to see you again. I hope you've been practising those skills of yours since our last encounter.{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_new:close_window|Heh, of course. One day we shall do battle again.{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_new:close_window.1|I have, and I'm here to test them out on you Dagmer Cleftjaw.{***}
dlga_start:geoffrey_talk|What? What do you want? - He takes the jug of beer to his lips as he looks at you with disgust. - Leave me be, {knave/wench}: I've no time for beggars!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk:close_window|Nothing, never mind.{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk:geoffrey_hostile|You're too far from home, Ironman, to stir trouble here.{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk:geoffrey_talk_2|And you are?{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_2:geoffrey_talk_3|I'm Dagmer! - He swells his chest. - Captain of the ship Thrall's Bane and raider of the Sunset Seas!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_3:geoffrey_talk_4|Hmm, I see. And how many towns have you pillaged?{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_4:geoffrey_talk_5|Every town from here to Bear Island has felt my wrath. If I were you, I'd leave before you taste my axe as well!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_5:close_window|Hmm, alright. I think I'll be leaving now.{***}
dlga_geoffrey_talk_5:geoffrey_hostile|HAH! You think you scare me with your stories of fame and conquest? I spit on you!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_hostile:geoffrey_hostile_4|Arghh! I'll have your head for that insult, scum! Outside the town walls at noon. Or are you too coward to face me in the field?!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_hostile_4:geoffrey_flee1|[Intimidate with Strength]{***}
dlga_geoffrey_hostile_4:close_window|I'll be waiting!{***}
dlga_geoffrey_flee1:close_window|Bah... this town has no worth anyway. Tell your Rory I'll be gone within the hour.{***}
dlga_start:hareck_talk|Yes? - He says, looking down. - Can I help you?{***}
dlga_hareck_talk:hareck_troublemakers|Is something wrong? You look worried.{***}
dlga_hareck_talk:close_window|Nothing. Farewell.{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers:hareck_troublemakers_2|Oh, it's nothing, just...{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_2:hareck_troublemakers_3|You can tell me, ser.{***}

dlga_hareck_troublemakers_3:hareck_troublemakers_4|No harm in it, I suppose. The trouble is, a few of the foreigners...those Ironmen from across the sea. They came to pillage our small town but decided to stay.Since then they've been drinking all our wine, fucking all our women and causing trouble with the locals.They take what they want and no one here can stop them.{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_4:hareck_troublemakers_5|Hmm... would there be a reward for solving this problem?{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_5:hareck_troublemakers_6|What? What are you saying?{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_6:hareck_troublemakers_7|Nothing, ser. However, it sounds to me like a neutral third party might be justwhat you need. I could talk to them.{***}

dlga_hareck_troublemakers_7:hareck_troublemakers_8|Heh. Well, you can try, {lad/lassie}. If you manage to do any good, I'll even throw in afew coins for getting the sand out of my breeches. Their leader is an Ironborn captain called Dagmer Cleftjaw, spends most of his timedrinking wine and fucking whores. Chances are you'll find him nearby.{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_8:close_window|Thank you, ser. I'll return after I've solved your problem.{***}
dlga_hareck_talk:hareck_troublemakers_10|Ser, those Ironmen shouldn't be a problem any longer.{***}

dlga_hareck_troublemakers_10:hareck_troublemakers_11|Truly? Thank you, {lad/lassie}! A few more days and I would've thrown them all into a cell and castaway the key. Here, take this. You've earned it.{***}
dlga_hareck_troublemakers_11:close_window|My pleasure, ser. If you've any other jobs that need doing, please let me know. Farewell.{***}
dlga_hareck_talk:hareck_troublemakers_15|I've failed, ser. I'm sorry.{***}

dlga_hareck_troublemakers_15:close_window|Oh... well. I suppose you tried your best. Thank you, anyway, {lad/lassie}. Perhaps some otherjob will suit you better. I'll let you know when I have any. Farewell.{***}
dlga_start:celidon_beric1|Hail and well met, {playername}. We've been watching you..{***}
dlga_celidon_beric1:celidon_beric2|You have?!{***}

dlga_celidon_beric2:celidon_beric3|Of course. You know, it matters not whose cloak you wear: Lannister, Stark, or Baratheon. If you prey on the weak, the Brotherhood Without Banners will hunt you down.{***}
dlga_celidon_beric3:celidon_beric4|Me? Pray on the weak? You've got the wrong {guy/woman}.{***}
dlga_celidon_beric3:close_window|Pah... I prey on whom I choose. You think you can stop me?!{***}
dlga_celidon_beric4:celidon_beric5|Maybe... but then, maybe not. You could prove your innocence by completing a small task.{***}
dlga_celidon_beric5:celidon_beric6|Sure, why not? What do you need?{***}
dlga_celidon_beric5:close_window|No thanks.{***}
dlga_start:bye2|Glad to see you're still alive, {playername}.{***}
dlga_bye2:close_window|The same for yourself, Beric.{***}
dlga_start:relic_find_question|Have you dispatched the Lannister raiding party yet?{***}
dlga_relic_find_question:relic_znaleziona|Yes! They all lie slaughtered. They won't be causing any more problems around here.{***}
dlga_relic_find_question:close_window|No, not yet.{***}

dlga_relic_znaleziona:close_window|Excellent! I've something a little different as your reward, {playername}. This book you recovered, It's extremely valuable and now it's yours. Feel free to sell it if you don't feel like keeping it to yourself.{***}
dlga_relic_znaleziona:close_window.1|You lying bastard! You remember me saying, 'We've been watching you'?!{***}

dlga_celidon_beric6:celidon_beric7|We've heard rumours of a Lannister raiding party burning and pillaging the villages nearby: you're to seek them out and bring them to justice by any means necessary. You'll be paid a small sum for your services. I expect proof though that these bastards have been dealt with. They've a book taken from a village after they burnt it to the ground
column2: bring me that book, and that will be the proof I need.{***}

column1: dlga_celidon_beric7:celidon_beric8|I've never liked this Lannister scum anyway: I'll see to it done!{***}
dlga_celidon_beric7:close_window|No, thanks. Those men and women can burn for all I care.{***}
dlga_celidon_beric8:close_window|I hope so, {playername}.{***}
dlga_start:lr_party1|I yield! Please, don't kill me! I was only following orders!{***}
dlga_lr_party1:close_window|Orders or not, a Lannister always pays his debts, and you will pay yours with your life.{***}
dlga_start:order2|So, who do we have here, eh?{***}
dlga_order2:order3|I'm here to bring you and your men to justice for the crimes you've committed on the smallfolk.{***}
dlga_order3:close_window|Haha, you hear that lads?! This scum wants to punish us. This is war, {son/gal}, and you're about to find out that war, has no place for {boys/girls} like you!{***}
dlga_order2:close_window.1|Sorry... I'll be leaving.{***}

dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder:oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_1|Well, good greetings. Pyr's my name. You're in a dangerous place, friend. There is talk of a Targaryen from across the water and of dragons. The Seven Kingdoms are at war, and Westeros has become a very dangerous place! You must be careful.{***}

dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_1:oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_4|I will. Do you happen to have some work for me? Something that will give me a chance to swing my sword and fill my purse! It's a little too empty at the moment...{***}

dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_4:oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5|Aye, there is always work for a daring soul such as yourself. While the Seven Kingdoms are at war, bandits roam the roads giving travellers and merchants no peace. We can't even travel due to fear of having our guts spilled all over the road! And to make matters worse, the summer months are due to be over. Winter is coming...{***}
dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5:oim_intro_kill_bandits_start|Find and kill the bandits.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5:oim_intro_taxes_lower|Persuade the king to lower taxes in the wake of winter.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5:oim_bring_goods_in_zamoshie_intro|Bring in some goods.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5:close_window|Leave...{***}

dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_start:oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog|Bandits have settled in the forest nearby and set out to plunder us each day. They rape our women and kill our children! There are only a few of them, but numbers matter not: our peasants are not trained for battle...{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog:oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_start_quest|Agree...{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_start_quest:oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_start_quest_1|Bandits, eh? I'll teach that scum a lesson they won't forget! Tell me where I can find them.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_start_quest_1:close_window|They're lurking in the forest right past the village. Go and kill those bastards... we'll reward you as best as we can.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog:oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_refuge|Refuse...{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_refuge:oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_refuge_1|I've got urgent business elsewhere, so I'm afraid I cannot help.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_kill_bandits_dialog_refuge_1:oim_intro_zamoshie_elder_5|Very well then... we'll just have to search for another who might protect us. What else can we do?{***}

dlga_zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_1:zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_2|How art thou? It's been a long time since we've seen such an interesting personage as thyself. What bringest thou hither, sirrah?{***}

dlga_zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_2:zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_3|You speak with an eloquent tongue... I would presume you fight just as well? I'm on the hunt for some local bandits - perhaps that would be you?{***}

dlga_zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_3:zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_4|Alas, we're not mere bandits, {knave/wench}, but fair and upright forest brothers. We do for ourselves the best we can, rob from the rich, and give to the poor - and take but a token share for ourselves, as reward for our daring feats of arms.{***}

dlga_zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_4:zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_5|That's strange... according to the local villagers, it's you who are taking from the poor even their last pittance. This seems far from noble to me... and they've asked of me to put an end to this disgraceful situation.{***}

dlga_zamoshien_badits_dialog_prebattle_5:close_window|Zounds! Thou, nameless villain, dareth to slander us?! Aye, {knave/wench}, a long time has passed since our daggers last bit flesh. Let's test the colour of thy blood! Kill that scoundrel!{***}

dlga_oim_zamoshie_killed_bandits:oim_zamoshie_killed_bandits_1|Good greetings, the bandits have all been slaughtered, and their corpses are rotting in the ground. They'll pester you no more. You do remember your promise, right?{***}
dlga_oim_zamoshie_killed_bandits_1:oim_zamoshie_killed_bandits_2|Of course, how could I forget? Here, take these provisions. They'll help you on your way. And thank you for your help!{***}
dlga_oim_zamoshie_killed_bandits_2:oim_choose_quests|Perhaps I could offer you further aid?{***}
dlga_oim_choose_quests:oim_choose_quests_answer|Well...{***}

dlga_oim_choose_quests_answer:oim_bring_goods_in_zamoshie_intro|Bring in some goods.{***}
dlga_oim_choose_quests_answer:village_elder_pretalk|Return...{***}
dlga_oim_help_to_find_icon:village_elder_pretalk|Thank you, my {lord/lady}. We've no other needs at the time.{***}

dlga_oim_intro_taxes_lower:oim_intro_taxes_lower_1|There is one more thing... our king has set the taxes so high that we cannot bear it! Our very survival is at stake! We thought of sending humble messengers to his majesty, but we are too frightened... and the roads are far too perilous. Come to our aid, good {man/lady}. Talk to the king, and beg him to lower our taxes.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_taxes_lower_1:oim_intro_taxes_lower_agree|Agree...{***}

dlga_oim_intro_taxes_lower_agree:close_window|I could speak to him on your behalf, surely... but I've arrived in these land not long ago. I know no one, and no one can stand by my word but me alone. To persuade the king would be no easy task.{***}
dlga_oim_intro_taxes_lower_1:oim_choose_quests_disagree|Refuse...{***}

dlga_oim_choose_quests_disagree:oim_choose_quests_disagree_1|I'm but a passerby in these lands... it's no business of mine to petition the ruler on behalf of his serfs. You'll have to find another to run this errand for you.{***}

dlga_oim_choose_quests_disagree_1:close_window|Well, I've my answer then. But know this - one cannot live by the sword alone... you'd be wise to master the art of speech as well. Otherwise you won't be worth the soil you're standing upon.{***}

dlga_oim_fedor_obuhovich_lower_taxes_2_b:oim_convince_options|Why should you care, {ser/madam}? You know very well that we're at war. By tomorrow, the enemy army may arrive here. We must swiftly gather all the silver we can... to better reinforce the Dreadfort walls.{***}

dlga_member_talk:member_separate|We need to separate for a while.{***}
dlga_member_separate:member_separate_confirm|Oh really? Well, I'm not just going to wait around here. I'm going to travel around the towns to look for work. Is that what you want?{***}
dlga_member_separate:companion_quitting|Well, actually, there was something I needed to tell you.{***}
dlga_member_separate_confirm:member_separate_yes|That's right. We need to part ways.{***}
dlga_member_separate_confirm:do_member_trade|No, I'd rather have you at my side.{***}
dlga_member_separate_yes:close_window|Well. I'll be off then. Look me up if you need me.{***}
dlga_member_talk:member_question|I'd like to ask you something.{***}
dlga_member_talk:close_window|Never mind.{***}
dlga_member_question:member_question_2|Very well. What did you want to ask?{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_morale|How do you feel about the way things are going in this company?{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_background_recap|Tell me your story again.{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_kingsupport_1|I suppose you know that I aspire to be {king/queen} of this land?{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_intelgathering_1|Do you have any connections that we could use to our advantage?{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_improverels_1|I would like to improve my relations with a settlement.{***}
dlga_member_question_2:member_fief_grant_1|Would you be interested in holding a fief?{***}
dlga_member_question_2:close_window|Never mind.{***}
dlga_member_morale:do_member_trade|{s21}{***}
dlga_member_background_recap:member_background_recap_2|{s5}{***}

dlga_member_background_recap_3:do_member_trade|Then shortly after, I joined up with you.{***}
dlga_do_member_view_char:member_talk|Anything else?{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_1:do_member_trade|Um... yes. I've heard so.{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_1:member_kingsupport_1a|{s21}{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_1a:member_kingsupport_2|Would you then support my cause?{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_1a:do_member_trade|Very good. I shall keep that in mind.{***}

dlga_member_kingsupport_2:do_member_trade|I would, {s21}. Moreover, I have a proposal on how I might help you attain the Iron Throne. But you've recently sent {s22} off on a similar mission. Perhaps we should wait for a couple of weeks to avoid drawing too much attention to ourselves.{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_3a:member_kingsupport_4|Very good. You do that.{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_3a:do_member_trade|On second thought, stay with me for a while.{***}
dlga_member_kingsupport_4:close_window|Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while.{***}
dlga_member_improverels_1:member_improverels_2|What settlement do you have in mind?{***}
dlga_member_improverels_2:do_member_trade|Actually, forget about this, maybe later.{***}
dlga_member_improverels_3:close_window|Very well. I will travel there and try to improve your relations with {s4}, {s21}.{***}
dlga_member_intelgathering_1:member_intelgathering_3|{s21}{***}

dlga_member_intelgathering_3:member_intelgathering_3|Of course, as few people should know of this as possible. If you want to collect the information, or pull me out, then don't send a messenger. Come and get me yourself - even if that means you have to sneak through the gates.{***}
dlga_member_intelgathering_3:member_intelgathering_4|Splendid idea - you do that.{***}
dlga_member_intelgathering_3:do_member_trade|Actually, hold off for now.{***}
dlga_member_intelgathering_4:close_window|Good. I should be ready to report in about five days. Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4_start:close_window|Those bastards are attacking anyone associated with House Stark! You must help us fight!{***}
dlga_start:relative_saved_1a|Thank you! Thank you, {ser/my lady}, for rescuing me from those fiends. Did my brother in {s9} put you onto their track?{***}
dlga_relative_saved_1a:close_window|Yes. I told him that I would find you. I advise you to return to your family as quickly as you can... and be careful on the road.{***}
dlga_start:bandit_leader_1a|Frith! Frith! Spare me! Spare my life! Let me go, good {ser/madam}}, and I'll go far away from here and learn an honest trade, and you'll never hear of me again!{***}

dlga_bandit_leader_1a:bandit_leader_1b|I'll spare your life, but in exchange I want information. Either you or your mates have kidnapped the brother of a prominent merchant in town. Tell me where you're hiding him, and give me your word that you'll stop troubling the people of these parts. Then you can go free.{***}
dlga_start:looter_leader_1|What do you want?{***}
dlga_looter_leader_1:looter_leader_2|I've been looking for you. Tell me where you keep your prisoners, and I'll let you go.{***}
dlga_looter_leader_1:close_window|Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.{***}
dlga_looter_leader_2:looter_leader_3|Hah! Those prisoners are only going free if you pay their ransom. I want silver stags! A lot of them! Did you bring any coins?{***}
dlga_looter_leader_3:close_window|No. The only thing I've brought is steel.{***}

dlga_bandit_leader_1b:close_window|Oh bless you, {ser/my lady}. Bless you. We've done the lad no harm. We've been keeping him in our hideout near {s9}. I'll describe the area nearby in detail, so there's no mistaking it...{***}
dlga_start:rescue_prisoner_succeed_2|{playername}, you saved him! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}. Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.{***}
dlga_rescue_prisoner_succeed_2:lord_pretalk|Always an honour to serve, {s65}.{***}

dlga_start_up_quest_1_next:close_window|Are you all right? Well... I guess you're alive, at any rate. I'm not sure that we can say the same for the other fellow. That's one less thief to trouble our streets at night, damn bastards are everywhere. Let's talk more inside.{***}

dlga_start:merchant_quest_2a|Splendid work. You've hired enough men to take on the bandits. Now, travellers entering {s9} have told us that there's a small group of robbers lurking on the outside of town. I suspect that they're all from the same band, the one that took my brother. Hunt them down and defeat them, and make them disclose the location of their lair!{***}

dlga_start:merchant_quest_3a|So, you've found out where they hid my brother? Splendid work. I flatter myself that I'm a fine judge of character, and you look to be a {man/woman} who can get things done. Now, go out and save his unworthy hide!{***}

dlga_start:merchant_quest_3b|Well... my brother is home safe. I'm not sure what to do with him - maybe pack him off to King's Landing. That way, if he gets knocked on the head in a street brawl, no one can say it's my fault. But that's not your problem. Here's the rest of your reward. It's well-earned.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_3b:merchant_quest_4a|The money is most welcome, and I'm glad to have been of service.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4a:merchant_quest_4b|Good! Now... are you interested in making some more money?{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b:merchant_quest_4b1|Possibly. What do you need?{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4b1:merchant_quest_4b2|Remember how I told you that the bandits had an ally inside the walls? I think I know who it is: the captain of the watch, no less. Some months ago, this captain, seeing the amount of profit we merchants were making from trade across the frontiers, decided to borrow some money to sponsor a caravan. Unfortunately, like many who are new to commerce, he failed to realize that great profit only comes with great risk. So, he sank all his money into the most expensive commodities, and, of course, his caravan was captured and looted, and he lost everything.{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4b2:merchant_quest_4b3|As a consequence, it seems our captain's turned to villainy to recoup his fortune. I supposed I'd do the same if, the Seven forbid, I ever faced indebtedness and ruination. Now, any watch captain worth his salary will have a few thieves and robbers on his payroll, to inform on the rest, but our captain decides to employ these bastards wholesale. He brings them into the town, lets them do as they will, and takes a share of their take. You've heard of poachers turning gamekeepers? Well, in these unfortunate lands, sometimes gamekeepers will turn poacher as well. Luckily, there are still a few brave, honest souls in the watch who've told me how he works.{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4b3:merchant_quest_4b4|Now, here's my plan. I could bring this to the attention of {s4}, lord of the city, but that would mean an inquiry, my word against the captain's, and witnesses can be bought and evidence destroyed, or maybe the whole thing will be forgotten if the enemy comes across the border again, and all I'll get for my trouble is a knife in the ribs. In time of war, you see, a king's eye wanders far from his domain, and his subjects suffer. So I've got another idea. I've got a small group of townsfolk together, some men in my employ and some others who've lost relatives to these bandits, and we'll storm the captain's home and bring him in chains before {s4}, hopefully with a few captured bandits to explain how things stack up.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b4:merchant_quest_4b5|All I need now is someone to lead my little army into battle, and I can't think of anyone better than you. So, what do you say?{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b5:merchant_quest_4b6|How do I know that you're telling me the truth?{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4b6:merchant_quest_4b7|Oh, well, I suppose it's possible that I found a dozen bandits who were willing to give their lives to give a passing stranger a false impression of life in old {s4}... well, I guess you can't really know if my word is good, but I reckon you've learned by now that my money is good, and there's another 100 silver stags, or maybe a bit more, that's waiting for you if you'll do me this last little favour. So, what do you say?{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b7:merchant_quest_4b8|All right. I'll lead your men.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b7:merchant_quest_4_decline|I'm sorry. This is too much, too fast. I need time to think.{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4b8:merchant_quest_4b9|Splendid. It's been a long time since I staked so much on a single throw of the dice, and frankly I find it exhilarating. My men are ready to move on your word. Are you ready?{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b9:merchant_quest_4_accept|Yes. Give them the sign.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4b9:merchant_quest_4_decline|Not now. I'll need to rest before I can fight again.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_4_accept:close_window|Good! Strike hard, strike fast, and the captain and his henchmen won't know what hit them. May the Seven be with you!{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_4_decline:close_window|Right. I can keep my men standing by. If you let this go too long, then I suppose that I'll have to finish this affair without you, but I'd be most pleased if you could be part of it as well. For now, take what time you need.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:close_window|Very well. I'll hunt for bandits.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:merchant_quest_2a_whynotcome|Why don't you come with us?{***}

dlga_merchant_quest_2a_whynotcome:merchant_quest_2a|Because I'm paying you to go and take care of it. That's the short answer. The long answer is that I've got some leads to follow up here in town, and I've just as much a chance of getting knocked on my head as you, if that's what you're asking. But I respect your question. Now, what do you say?{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:close_window.1|I cannot deal with this matter at this time.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_3a:close_window|Very well. I go now to attack the bandits in their lair and find your brother.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_3a:close_window.1|I cannot deal with this matter at this time.{***}
dlga_start:merchant_quest_persuasion12|Good luck, {ser/my lady}.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_3a:merchant_quest_persuasion|You make a persuasive case. I'm going to help you.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_2|You make a persuasive case. I'm going to help you.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_3|You make a persuasive case. I'm going to help you.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_4b8|You make a persuasive case. I'm going to help you.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion12:close_window|Thank you. Farewell.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_2:merchant_quest_2a|Now, go find and defeat that group of bandits.{***}
dlga_merchant_quest_3:merchant_quest_3a|Now, go attack that bandit hideout, get my brother back, and show those brigands what happens to those who threaten my household.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.36|Oh... praised be the Seven... am I safe?{***}

dlga_start:merchant_closing_statement_2|Ah, {playername}. Things didn't go quite so well as I had hoped. {s5} couldn't quite find it in him to overlook my little breach of the peace. Oh, he's grateful enough that I got rid of his crooked captain
column2: a guard who'll let in bandits will let in an enemy army if the price is right, but he can't exactly have me running around here as a lasting reminder of his failure to take care of things himself.{***}

column1: dlga_merchant_closing_statement_2:merchant_closing_statement_3|That hardly seems fair...{***}

dlga_merchant_closing_statement_3:merchant_closing_statement_4|Fair? This is Westeros, {my boy/my lady}! Kings do what they want, and the rest of us do as they must. He didn't string me up and instead gave me time to sell my properties - even put in a word with the other merchants that they best pay me a fair price, too. That's gracious enough, as kings go, but he's a weak king, as they all are here, and weak kings must always look to their authority first, and justice second. I suppose I'd do the same in his shoes.{***}
dlga_merchant_closing_statement_4:close_window|Anyway, I wouldn't go rubbing your part in this affair in {s5}'s face
column2: nevertheless, he's taken note of you and decided that you're not worth hanging, and that's something to which I'll raise a glass any day of the week. He might even have work for you, further down the road. Or you can sell your sword to one of his competitors. Anyway, I hope you've learned a bit about what it will take to stay alive in this troubled land, and I suspect that the money you've earned won't go to waste. Good luck.{***}

column1: dlga_merchant_quests_last_word:close_window|I'm preparing to leave town in a short while. It's been an honour to know you, {lad/lassie}. Good luck.{***}
dlga_member_intel_liaison:member_intel_liaison_results|What have you discovered?{***}
dlga_start:member_intel_liaison|Greetings, stranger.{***}
dlga_member_intel_liaison:close_window|It's time to pull you out. Let's leave town separately, but join me soon after.{***}
dlga_member_intel_liaison:close_window.1|You're doing good work. Stay here for a little longer.{***}
dlga_member_intel_liaison_results:member_intel_liaison|{s11} I noticed that you' ve been keeping some notes about individual lords. I've annotated those with my findings.{***}
dlga_member_fief_grant_1:member_fief_grant_2|Which fief did you have in mind?{***}
dlga_member_fief_grant_2:member_fief_grant_3|{s11}{***}
dlga_member_fief_grant_2:do_member_trade|Never mind. There is no fief I can offer.{***}
dlga_member_fief_grant_3:close_window|{s5}{***}
dlga_start:close_window.37|Let's leave whenever you're ready.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.38|Please don't waste any more of my time today, {ser/madame}. Perhaps we'll meet again in our travels.{***}

dlga_companion_recruit_intro_response:companion_recruit_backstory_a|{s6}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_intro_response:close_window|{s7}{***}

dlga_companion_recruit_backstory_response:close_window|{s7}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_signup:companion_recruit_signup_b|{s5}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_signup_response:close_window|Unfortunately, I can't take on any more hands in my party right now.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_signup_response:companion_recruit_payment|{s6}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_signup_response:close_window.1|{s7}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_payment:companion_recruit_signup_confirm|.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_payment_response:companion_recruit_signup_confirm|{s6}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_payment_response:close_window|Sorry, I can't afford that at the moment.{***}
dlga_start:companion_recruit_meet_again|We meet again.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_meet_again:companion_recruit_backstory_delayed|So... what have you been doing since our last encounter?{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_meet_again:close_window|Good day to you.{***}
dlga_start:companion_recruit_secondchance|Yes?{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_secondchance:companion_recruit_backstory_b|My apologies if I was rude earlier. What was your story again?{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_secondchance:close_window|Never mind.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_backstory_delayed:companion_recruit_backstory_delayed_response|{s5}{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_backstory_delayed_response:companion_recruit_signup_b|I might be able to use you in my army.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_backstory_delayed_response:close_window|I'll let you know if I hear of anything.{***}
dlga_companion_recruit_signup_confirm:close_window|Good! Give me a few moments to prepare, and I'll be ready to move.{***}
dlga_start:companion_rehire|My offer to rejoin you still stands, if you'll have me.{***}

dlga_start:companion_rehire.1|It's good to see you alive, {s5}! {s6}, and I did not know whether you had been captured, or slain, or got away. I've been roaming around since then, looking for you. Shall I get my gear together and rejoin your company?{***}
dlga_start:companion_prison_break_chains|I've come to break you out of here.{***}
dlga_companion_prison_break_chains:close_window|Thank the Seven you came! However, I'm not going anywhere with these chains on my legs. You'll need to get the key away from the guard somehow.{***}
dlga_start:companion_rehire.2|{s5}{***}
dlga_start:companion_was_dismissed|It is good to see you, {s21}! To tell you the truth, I had hoped to run into you.{***}
dlga_companion_was_dismissed:companion_rehire|{s5}. Would you want me to rejoin your company?{***}
dlga_companion_rehire:companion_recruit_signup_confirm|Welcome back, my friend!{***}
dlga_companion_rehire:companion_rehire_refused|Sorry, I can't take on anyone else right now.{***}
dlga_companion_rehire_refused:close_window|Well... look me up if you change your mind, eh?{***}
dlga_start:companion_rehire.3|So... do you want me back yet?{***}
dlga_start:player_sandor1_talk|What do you want?{***}
dlga_player_sandor1_talk:close_window|Nothing.{***}
dlga_player_sandor1_talk:sandor_reply_talk|What are you doing?{***}
dlga_sandor_reply_talk:sandor2|I'm protecting the King. Now run along, cunt!{***}
dlga_sandor2:close_window|Alright, I'm going.{***}
dlga_sandor2:sandor3|One day, I will have your head!{***}
dlga_sandor3:close_window|Haha, you think that bothers me, {boy/girl}?!{***}
dlga_start:close_window.39|I can't speak right now.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.40|I'm busy.{***}
dlga_start:player_ygritte1_talk|Be careful of the White Walkers!{***}
dlga_player_ygritte1_talk:close_window|Umm, OK...{***}
dlga_player_ygritte1_talk:ygritte_reply_talk|What? White Walkers?{***}
dlga_ygritte_reply_talk:close_window|That's what I said. Stay south of the Wall unless you want to become one of those... things!{***}
dlga_start:close_window.41|People work together when it suits 'em. They're loyal when it suits 'em. Love each other when it suits 'em. And they kill each other when it suits 'em.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.42|We have work to do {playername}. The realms of men rely on us to do our job, we do not have time for small talk.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.43|If you want to join the watch, you should speak with {s1}.{***}
dlga_event_triggered:close_window.1|You still stray from the path {playername}. I shall not ask again.{***}
dlga_event_triggered:close_window.2|The lives of those that live behind that wall is worth more than your side quests {playername}. I'm leaving, good luck.{***}

dlga_event_triggered:close_window.3|Where are we going? We should probably be concentrating on the task at hand {playername}. If you are unable to complete the quest then I shall leave and complete it myself.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.44|Leave me be, I'm busy.{***}
dlga_start:close_window.45|I'm busy!{***}

dlga_minister_issues:minister_pretalk|There's a matter which needs your attention. The quarrel between {s11} and {s12} has escalated to a point where it has become unseemly. If you do intervene, you risk offending one of the lords. However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {ser/madam}.{***}

dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk|{s1} currently does not have a lord. You may wish to keep it this way, as lords will sometimes gravitate towards lieges who have land to offer, but for the time being, no one is collecting any of its rents.{***}

dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.1|At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention, my {lord/lady}. I should point out though that I'm not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I'm anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?{***}

dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.2|If I may offer you a word of advice, my {lord/lady}, it seems that your right to rule as an independent monarch isn't sufficiently recognized, and this may bring us problems further down the road. It may be advisable to find a kingdom with whom you've shared interests and seek its recognition to establish yourself as an equal with other kings.{***}
dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.3|At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention, my {lord/lady}. Is there anything you wish to be done?{***}
dlga_minister_pretalk:minister_talk|Is there anything you wish to be done, my {lord/lady}?{***}
dlga_minister_talk:combined_political_quests|Do you have any ideas to strengthen our kingdom's unity?{***}
dlga_minister_talk:offer_gift_quest_complete|I've got the materials for {s4}'s gift.{***}
dlga_offer_gift_quest_complete:close_window|Ah, let me take those. Hopefully this will mend the quarrel between you two. You may wish to speak to {reg4?her:him} and see if I've had any success.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_cancel_political_quest|Let's abandon our plan to {s10}.{***}
dlga_minister_cancel_political_quest:minister_cancel_political_quest_confirm|Are you sure you want to drop that idea?{***}
dlga_minister_cancel_political_quest_confirm:minister_pretalk|Yes, I'm sure. Let's abandon that idea.{***}
dlga_minister_cancel_political_quest_confirm:minister_pretalk.1|Actually, never mind.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_diplomatic_kingdoms|I wish to dispatch an emissary.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_indict|I wish to indict a disloyal vassal for treason.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_change_marshal|I wish to replace {s4} as marshal.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_change_marshal.1|I wish to appoint a new marshal.{***}

dlga_minister_change_marshal:minister_pretalk|You've just made such an appointment, {ser/madam}. If you countermand your decree so soon, there'll be great confusion. We'll need to wait a few days.{***}
dlga_minister_talk:minister_training_lair0_tr|I'd like to discuss the training of men.{***}
dlga_minister_training_lair0_tr:minister_training_lair0|I can take your recruits and turn them into warriors.{***}
dlga_minister_training_lair0:minister_training_lair3|I need some men in the garrison to be trained.{***}
dlga_minister_training_lair0:minister_training_lair4_stop|Stop training men here.{***}
dlga_minister_training_lair0:minister_pretalk|Never mind.{***}
dlga_minister_training_lair3:minister_training_lair3_a|Do you want me to use an alternative promotion when available?{***}
